fibUlR7Q18Nj_90EAWkm0Q.text: I really like Intermezzo. Lasagne is very fine. Menu doesn't really resemble the menu posted on yelp.

iDKogb2G3huGpqC0WdV3IA.text: Solid 4 stars... verging on 4.5 stars for Intermezzo!  I will definitely come back and try their other menu offerings.  A small group of us went on a chilly Thursday evening.  The bar regulars looked to be out in force but the dining room was pretty quiet.  It did pick up a little towards the end, but I did appreciate the cozy environment, the available art (for sale) on the walls, and the personable and nice service.  Definitely needed a martini to drown out the workday so I asked the barkeep/server if he had recommendations and he recommended the French Martini.  I had been eyeing it on the menu so that's what I went with.  For my dinner, I was determined to order some Serbian delight... and went with the Ground Beef Burek.  It was accompanied by a side of greens with a balsamic drizzle.  Super yummy... it was a big plate of food and I ate it ALL.  Unfortunately didn't have room for dessert based on my entree and my (multiple) martinis.  Overall a great place.  I'm already planning my return trip!  Side Note:  It also helps, being an avid tennis fan (and wannabe player) that the current #1 player in the world Novak Djokovic is Serbian.  Now I doubt this diet regime would include the items offered here to maintain his fitness, but I have no doubt he would totally be eating at Intermezzo whenever (if ever) he comes to Charlotte for some "home" cookin'.

-q9MqHUFIaTfM-Yd1_Lo9Q.text: This has to be one of the worst dining experiances I have ever had. The waiter was very rude and ended up skipping our table a few times before he was stopped and asked when it would be our turn to order. He then proceeded to roll his eyes and put out a finger saying you wait a minute, then when the owner was approached about the waiters Behavior comma he was not any better. The owner as well was very rude to us, and told us that his waiter would never do something like that again and if we didn't like their service that we didn't have to come back. The owner was not apologetic about the staffs Behavior at all and the food was even worse. They portray themselves to be a Serbian restaurant but don't really have any authentic food. They serve more bar style Italian style type of food period with the service and the food this is one of the worst experience I've ever had going to a restaurant and will never do it again.

PUbd2tF2gS_a5daZP3PVlw.text: Solid solid four stars.  I don't think I ordered the right thing so my dish was relatively, but I'd still recommend it because I think there's significant upside.  Cool setting, unique setup.  I'm surprised more people don't talk about this place.

79FdGl03fdKO6ezLINEcEg.text: Food was superb. I had the Chicken Francses with asparagus and rosemary mashed potatoes. The service was was on point. Very attentive and accommodating staff. Half price wine on Tuesday. I am a visitor to Charlotte and come from a food town.

m5SEnBRYNi311nTnUj_JlA.text: My girlfriends and I decided to eat here randomly last night. We ordered two appetizers to share. The goat cheese crostini and the garlic knot bread. Both were tasty but neither I would order again. At least I can say I tried them. My girlfriends got a pizza and the homemade ravioli to share and I tried the ravioli and it was amazing!!! I wish i would have ordered that!  I ordered the stuff peppers and they were ok. I expected a little more since the waiter talked them up so much but to me it was an ok dish. It basically was a pepper stuffed with beef and a small amount of rice with tomato sauce. Also, when I received my dish it was cold in the middle :( hopefully it will be better as leftovers at lunch today.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stuffed Pepper

pfygOlXhDa5o2bcM9Ai7XQ.text: So, I went to Intermezzo with my main squeeze a little over a year ago because we heard friends raving about their pizza and salads. Given the glowing reviews, we went and ordered the pizza and salad and were honestly a bit underwhelmed... the pizza was okay and the salad was humdrum & it's hard to drive past all of the amazing restaurants on Central and pass them up for something that we considered "just okay."   Two weeks ago my opinion of Intermezzo changed for the better... we were invited to a friend's birthday dinner there and went because we love our friend (not because we wanted to eat at Intermezzo again)... our friend recommended that we order off of the Serbian menu and OH MY GOODNESS, the food we ordered was off the hook! My husband ordered a Piroska (a fabulous stuffed pizza dish) and I sampled the Chicken Frickasee... both were amazing.   Thanks to our much more exciting second trip to Intermezzo, there will definitely be subsequent visits -we'll just make sure we order off of the Serbian section of the menu from now on!

QcBQMQI70VPrFkmvmhQ1mw.text: My boyfriend and I got take out from here tonight. We've been to the restaurant once and I remembered thinking it was good.   Tonight we got the bruschetta which was fine. It wasn't amazing. For our entree he got the blackened chicken pasta, which I tried. It tasted like this chef boyardie thing I used to eat when I was a kid. I got the four cheese pizza. Not the worst pizza I've ever had, however definitely not the best. There was barely any sauce and the cheese tasted plasticy.   Nothing to brag about.

vrHQZFC6bTC7vf_sVTXu3g.text: This place never disappoints! I live in South Florida but every time I come to Charlotte to visit the BF, I love coming here!  The food is beyond fresh and delicious. The service has always been fantastic.  The setting is cozy and rustic but not over the top. Every seat feels intimate and comfortable and the noise level is perfect.  My favorite is the Milanese pizza....omg yum! If you can't decide, they will do a half/half large pizza for you. We did the milanese/intermezzo supreme split...no regrets!!! WOOOH!  We got the red pepper bruschetta this past visit and believe me, I have thought about that alone several times this week during day dreams.  Our waitress was beyond helpful, accommodating and super attentive!  I really love the braided bread too being a carboholic.   I cannot wait to go back!

90n1H9qdNChKQAPQuTOA6w.text: Why did it take me so long to enjoy the pleasures of Intermezzo?  1/2 priced Martinis?!?!  Are you kidding me?? And they are delicious!  Our food was authentic and service was top notch.  We were there during a busy time of the night, where service can sometimes suffer.  Not this place!  Our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable.  I can't wait to go back time and time again to work my way thru the menu.

0c9_Dqo4o0wKUVQk3gOvCA.text: Came here for dinner one night and sat on the patio. The patio was a nice little covered area which was great and our server was really nice.  I was with a friend and we shared a margherita pizza. It was ok, overall I thought the pizza was pretty bland. There wasn't much basil on it and the tomatoes had no flavor.  I would like to go back and try something else though as they had a decent sized menu.

KY3B9AG3CT7gh3di68wp-g.text: Creative great food, funky Plaza Midwood vibe. Our regular Friday night date place. Don't get our table:)

9wNM8wrzCKiXTInQzBdvuQ.text: Hands-down the best pizza worth every single calorie that comes with it - every type of pizza is delicious especially the spinach ricotta as well as their meat pizza my finicky kids who are very picky about their pizza (I know it's weird) love this place.   Also they are consistently good I've gone there over 30 times and every single time it's delicious

XIrB3NORecsaPLSiccIQog.text: The idea of a Serbian restaurant was enough to entice me to purchase the Groupon to check it out, especially since I had never really thought about what Serbian cuisine was about. We headed to Intermezzo before hitting up The Comedy Zone and walked away impressed with the place.  Intermezzo does not look like much from the outside, but don't let the old building and gravel parking lot scare you...they serve up some decent grub. The interior is pretty neat with exposed brick walls and shelves of all these little miniature toys. The interior dining area is small but not cramped, and the outdoor patio area looked to add a lot more space, weather permitting. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable and got us going with our drinks. I got a draft of Founder's Porter ($5) and the miss' got a Cantaloupe Martini ($4.50 on a 1/2 off martini Saturday.)   For an appetizer we started with the Corn Dip ($8.75) which was a bit pricey for what you got. It was a small ramekin of corn niblets mixed with peppers, onions and cheese. The ramekin must have been placed in a salamander before coming out because the cheese topping crustified, much like a french onion soup would. Once we got everything mixed around it was pretty tasty paired with the tortilla chips, but it definitely wasn't $8.75 worthy. It was really surprising because the rest of the appetizers, and even the entrees, were reasonably priced, so I don't know what made a bunch of corn and cheese so expensive in comparison.  For dinner, after seeing all the rave reviews here on Yelp, I had to go with the Ground Beef Burek ($11.95.) It is a huge roll made of fillo dough, but not the fillo dough I'm used to. It was denser and crunchier than what I've had in Greek-style cheese pies and other foods, and it worked as a great exterior crust to the contents inside. It was filled with tons of a ground beef and onion mixture, and that was it. No sauce, no seasoning, just pure beef and sauteed onion. I think it was missing a little something initially, but I added some tzatziki sauce on top and that gave it a bit of umph it was initially missing. It also came with a decent-sized side salad of greens, tomato and cucumber with a balsamic dressing. The veggies were nice and fresh and the dressing had a nice sweetness to it.  The missus ordered the Cheese & Spinach Burek ($11.95) and I'm surprised to say that I liked hers more. The cheese consisted of ricotta so it was similar to a calzone filling, and the spinach was not obtrusive at all. In fact, I would go so far as to say that a burek that contained both ground beef and this cheese mixture would be a slam dunk hole in one home run goal.   Intermezzo is a pretty great restaurant that takes pride in their food. They also do pizzas and I am looking forward to returning in the near future to give them a whirl. Definitely worth checking out. One last note, I saw a guy running around doing deliveries so if you live nearby that may be a great option.

-kpU_fmhTTwpPHFDRFk64Q.text: I like this place, and the atmosphere inside is really cool. The chicken Florentine pizza is great if you wanted a healthier pizza :)

carBKOpTV7Hs7siUl8dZCw.text: I'm always hunting for excellent pizza.  This restaurant came up on many Charlotte lists of best pizza.  I'm not sure what style of pizza they're attempting, and it's absolutely fine to create your own style, but this simply wasn't good.  The woman at the host stand told me the pizza is cooked on a conveyor oven.  Again that's not a bad thing, but you need to know what you're doing to make a conveyor oven pizza taste great.  Maybe the Serbian food is better, I'll have to come back and try something else.  My advice is to go elsewhere for pizza.

T-5bKDAftjeahEYFQQWrNg.text: Great food and knowledgeable/friendly staff.  The loss of a star is due to when it got busy, the staff were stretched too thin and service really slowed down.  Not only was my water glass empty but I had eaten all of the ice before it was refilled.  From the looks of it, the same thing happened to a number of tables around us. However, the food was tasty and I love that they have unique beers on tap. Oh, and the dessert crepe was amazing.  I've tried some of Paris' best crepes and this 'Merican crepe crushed all of them.  I'd go back just for dessert.

O689LRo9HgGwsxGjn_WVVw.text: Last week my girlfriend and I ordered takeout from Intermezzo. My GF has allergies so I checked the order when I picked it up to see if it was correct. In the dim light it was hard to tell so I pointed out to the bartender who got it for me that the order looked incorrect. He was very belligerent, snapped that the order was correct, and walked away.  Unfortunately when we got back home we discovered it wasn't correct... the sides were right but the meals were someone else's dinner. We spent $30+ for a meal my GF couldn't eat. To the owner's credit when I called and pointed out the mistake she replied quickly and corrected the issue.  Overall the food is great and other than the experience with the bartender the staff was very polite.

Sv1rfRb-WELnVK8h2mwucA.text: Ummmm, my favorite pizza place in Charlotte. Intimate atmosphere, genuinely friendly service, family owned, house made mozzarella, the list goes on. Love it. The veggie lasagna and fungi pizza are my go to's.

mx7Sbz0ky7W3IFEIzMBHnQ.text: 3 stars for the food, minus 2 for the rude dude.....  Recently got a coupon for this place based on the reviews, and called to see if I could use it for take out, if not I would come back on a day that I had time to eat in.....no problem, take out with the coupon is fine(I was told).  I called the order in and arrived for pick up with coupon in hand and the rudeness begins............if you don't want to honor the coupon, don't participate in the program..........if take out is unacceptable for the coupon, don't tell me it's fine when I call......... I digress, the food was fine, but I will never return, nor will I recommend.

Rdb2DA2fjGUwVDBCHkgwSA.text: So I'm drafting this in the restaurant as we sit to eat dinner, so it doesn't get any more real or firsthand thoughts than this. I came here and invited some folks that. First things first. All my elites recommended the bruschetta, so we got both types cause it was half off.  Bruschetta: the first one I had was the one with basil. This one was good, and knowing that they make the mozzarella is something to mention. The basil taste I liked because it balanced the tomatoes. The second type of bruschetta was more tomato based, so that had more of that kind of flavor that I thought was okay.  I ordered the beef Burek and let's say its something new, it's sort of hard to explain but inside the bread it's stuffed with beef and onions. Not much taste, but it's different and I recommend you to get it. I feel like it lacked a sauce or something,  but it was good.  We also had the capriccioso pizza? I'm not sure if that's how you spell it, but it was delicious. I recommend any pizza, it wasn't overloaded with sauce at the same time it wasn't salty.   I also sampled the Wienerschnitzel that they had, which was pretty big. I recommend this dish. It's breaded pork served with a creamy sauce, topped with potatoes. The creamy sauce is a must though because if you don't it'll be a little dry.   Another dish we sampled was the Stuffed Cabbage, which was I say wasn't my favorite. It was sort of vinegary based, stuffed with beef and rice. It was sort of new, but not really that amazing in my opinion.  Inside is small and quaint. They have a full bar, no worries on getting drinks here! It's a casual type of restaurant, so no worries about what you wear. They have dining inside as well as outside, but outside has more seating. Our waiter was a girl named Veronica, who was very polite and nice.  I think I found a new place for pizza. And after looking at the pictures and reading this I hope I found you a new place to discover!

0OilqdQeFJ46qoAgmwK8ig.text: Been eating here since it opened. Consistantly excellent service and food quality. I highly value these Non-chain type Restaurants in Charlotte as things are getting more corporatized. Thank you Intermezzo for giving us a warm friendly alternative good food venue in PMW for all these years!

wNXQOEnAdoJy_AeAMH7jYg.text: Can't get enough of this place!  The atmosphere is enjoyable, the service is ALWAYS great, and the food cannot be beat!  Consistently delicious and reasonably priced.  This restaurant is especially enjoyable with large groups.  Thanks, Tre, for ensuring that we always have a good experience!

UKwa6xU3OZdprxStlfBSlA.text: Intermezzo is a fantastic place to come grab dinner and drinks with friends.  I went last time I was in Charlotte and I will be sure to come back at some point when I am in town.  Me and a friend split a large pizza, which they allowed us to customize so it was half Capriccioso and half Spinach Supreme.  It was fantastic pizza, much better quality than I was expecting.  The ambiance was nice and there was a great beer special which made the evening more fun.  I recommend this place.  If you are looking for a fun place with great food but not too pricey you can't go wrong.

7naZCVjatK7mEYzJiIRtoQ.text: Came in for lunch and had this amazing "little" gem called a Piroska (Balkan Style Stuffed Pizza) that tasted like a Stromboli and a Calzone had a delicious baby. Great service and great atmosphere. Will definitely be back...

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Piroska (Balkan Style Stuffed Pizza)

xYybFu1CnRmBlhzptryYCA.text: Definitely one of my favorite places in Charlotte, and here's why... - they really do make the best pizzas! Pick any from their list - you can't go wrong. - delicious traditional Serbian dishes (nothing healthy about 'em :) but so worth all the calories!) - comfortable, casual environment - super friendly staff - and they deliver to uptown!! so for those lazy evenings, when you're craving something delicious, you can order one of their perfectly created pizzas. i'm not sure if the magic is in the dough or in the sauce or toppings, but the pizzas are magical :)

MDHJF4qTRVdXoPQ3wzWV8w.text: Piroska (Balkan Style Stuffed Pizza). I am a DDD fan and wow the Piroska is real good. My server said while it is good they really wanted to showcase Karadjordjeva Pan Seared Schnitzel rolled with Ham, Kajmak, Skillet Potatoes, and Tartar Sauce. I just had to try the Piroska. And I am both happy and sad I did the Piroska is real good.  Service atmosphere and over all menu worth the trip!

5XB6yw-8kD5MP9_qBHFmrA.text: We went in on a Saturday afternoon and was surprised to see that it was pretty empty. We had looked at the menu online so we had an idea of what we wanted.  Our server seemed to have already had a bad day or something because he was unbearable. He seemed like he would rather be anywhere but there. They were out of the sarma which was a huge bummer because I really wanted to try it. We settled on a large pizza. The server kept trying to finish my sentences as I ordered and it was really irritating.  One thing I was confused about was the different pricing online and on the menu. The menu was priced at almost $2+ more than online. When I mentioned it to the server he said he would check on it...still waiting.  The pizza was good but not for $22. It had chicken, onions and cheese. Pretty overpriced for that thing. I figured I would be paying that amount for something phenomenal but the 99 cent pizza places in NYC beats their pizza. I loved the restaurant itself. The outside seating was great and the brick walls inside added something special to the decorative vibe.  3 stars for the decent pizza but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back there again when I go back to Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. chicken Milanese pizza

ULLYpuBtyuWVUr4kkguPnQ.text: To be fair, I didn't have any of the coveted Serbian dishes that make up the True soul of this place, but I'm really looking forward to returning here to do so. A group of 7 of us came here after going to an event at The Filmore, and we were hangry for some carbs. Pizza you say? That sounds like an amazing idea. Intermezzo it is!  We were seated promptly at one of the tables in the patio (covered and heated, so we weren't frigid). The service was quick and really helpful, I ordered the personal size of the veggie pizza (Garden Fresh) that was loaded with broccoli, mushrooms, and other veggies and had...*gulp* smoked gouda cheese. Let me tell you, I haven't been more excited to eat leftovers since the last time I went to a japanese steakhouse. All pizzas at the table were excellent! I can't wait to go back and try more dishes from them, and experience the Serbian side of things. In the meantime, please go and try their pizza, yelp!

vaTrLd3Baa85oJnNelri4g.text: the food was very good here, Italian and Serbian (hey I guess it is just a short trip over the Adriatic Sea).  My daughter had one of the best Chicken Francese dishes ever in a restaurant with a large, soft breaded chicken cutlet over a bed of delicious Rosemary seasoned mashed potatoes. My other daughter has a delicious mushroom pizza and I ordered the Ground Beef Burek (Filo Dough, Ground Beef, Onions) which frankly looked like baked intestines (with a similar concept, coiled tubes) but don't let that gross description dissuade you from ordering it, was quite delicious, also came with a nice salad and a cucumber like sauce on the side.  The portions were also very generous.  The outdoor seating was nice, but near a very busy intersection.  If I lived close by I would sample other items on the menu which seemed very appealing such as the stuffed cabbage and stuffed peppers.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fungi pizza, Ground Beef Burek and awesome Chicken Francese

oox1jaAPYuEBvl4vDbgN2w.text: Service was excellent! Went here while visiting family who live in Charlotte! Food was great! They were packed! We all ordered different items and all was delicious. We had a great time! Looking forward to going back next time we are in the area!

mpm96WIHbWXlcVtSF_paiw.text: Glad I found another place that can cater to my late night hunger needs! I've been meaning to try Intermezzo. Every time I pass by, the restaurant is packed - at all times (always a good sign). Plus, I love discovering new places to eat and indulge.   As we walked into Intermezzo, a dimly light setting coupled with wooden booths greets us - very elegant for a "pizzeria." Why the quotations, you may ask? When I surveyed the menu, to my surprise I found a list of Serbian Specialties. My eyes lit up and I am pleasantly surprised. Everything sounded delicious, but we locked down on a Smoked Gouda Burger and a traditional Serbian dish - Cheese and Spinach Burek. Both were delicious and I am excited to try the other Serbian dishes next time. Mission Eggplant Musaka is next!

ogcG11I-SUfEaW9869lMPw.text: Have been here multiple times, the Burek is very good and the weinerschnitzel as well, but we keep coming back for the pizza. The grilled veggie pizza is crazy good, wood-fired, all the toppings are one size (not sure why, but this is my jam), and it's reasonable that 3 people can share a large. Of course, my wife and I always end up splitting the large between the two of us because we're fat on the inside. Also love that they have beer specials, Friday night was $3 Birdsong taps YES PLEASE.

76KolCLZ8RkPTJ291TlDwQ.text: This is a go to spot for our family and any visitors we host. Cozy, great ambiance and atmosphere. Very interesting interior - Its an old building with exposed brick and wood - Rustic but decorated very modernly and artistically. They also have a large covered outdoor patio right at the street. Great for people watching.  The service is good. The wait staff have been there a long time and are attentive. The menu is unique. Tons of flavor. Somewhere between gourmet and comfort food. Consistently great creative flavorful food.  The owners are Serbian and so are some of the menu items. There are also gourmet wood fire pizzas and other European dishes.  They have a great beer selection on tap.  esp high gravity craft beers. Love this place.

8TxFNSSXnCSc9NKcAtypAg.text: Really great pizza and a lovely atmosphere!  Great place to bring the kids!  The stuffed cabbage is also very tasty!

c-gAkmW16iN8qeNs4LtP1w.text: I have been wanting to try Intermezzo for awhile and went last night for my first time. We were seated on the enclosed patio which felt isolated and unwelcoming, not to mention noisy from traffic and the blowing heaters. Our waiter is the reason for 1 star. He seemed annoyed when asked for a menu recommendation. Our food was brought by another server and our waiter never came back to check on us. Finally, my friend went in herself to ask for more water and a new fork for our table. The servers inside didn't even help her, so we had to wait even longer for our waiter to finally come back out and he did not even apologize and basically threw the new fork on the table. Terrible experience head to toe, will not come here again. Food was fine but not good enough to come back for that kind of experience.

Q8AJMtnR45SlWEotJVXvLA.text: The server (I think possibly one of the owners) was so nice and accommodating.   I am a huge fan of the Margherita pizza when made with a tomato base but don't really care for the olive oil base but my friend loves the oil base. This place offered to make the pizza half and half. No restaurant has ever offered to split a pizza with mixed bases. This was amazing customer service.   We also ordered Karadjordjeva. The skillet potatoes were awesome. I just wish there were more in the serving!

xYIjmxacr8--m1tXXMnMLA.text: Ask for Will.  Awesome service and great food. Corn dip is the bomb. Pizza is fantastic. Love this place. Quiet afternoon lunch and never had to ask for a thing. Will be back for sure!!! Excellent.

MfCZbSGBOUs5s7UE7gWuzg.text: Excellent service and outstanding food! My husband and I decided to try this place after it was featured on Triple D. We are so glad we did! We started off with the goat cheese and ricotta crostini with a side of marinara sauce and it was wonderful! My husband ordered the sarma and said it was delicious. I ordered the four cheese pizza. I have to say, it was one of the best pizzas I've ever had! The desserts looked scrumptious too. Intermezzo has instantly became a new favorite for us!

2qV7Y7nD_GH8ESVqPEfzdg.text: The pizza was absolutely amazing...one of the best we've had in Charlotte. Stuffed peppers are my favorite!

aw80Sn6BGxqQ2MLtHYMetg.text: Food is pretty good here. We usually just get pizza and a salad. Ive heard the Serbian food is really good. The service is up and down. The beer selection is very good and the atmosphere is cool.

3qIhbah83GohO4fnxTuoiQ.text: Went here this past week and had some decent pizza.  Nothing spectacular, but decent.  I got the 4 cheese pizza and I really did enjoy it but I was actually surprised it had red sauce on it.  I was just expecting a white pizza for some reason.    The beer selection was kind of small, but I can always find something I like so that wasn't a problem.  And overall, the service was very good.  The waitress was attentive but not overbearing.  Finding a decent pizza/Italian place in NC is kind of rare, so I would definitely go back.  The best part was the patio with the great view of the skyline.  However, I do wish the other buildings around there were a bit nicer.  It would be better if it was slightly farther down Central.  Check it out if you're in the area!

puku99N8qdlajqzcQmtXwg.text: Great food and cool space. Have tasted a lot of the menu and it never lets me down. I think it is the best pizza in Charlotte.

G_i9AMI-FmoDE71xRwrF2g.text: This is my new place to take somebody from out of town, dates, or just chow down with friends.  The place is very comfortable and clean. Their beer selection is great (try the Effemer Apple beer).  Appetizers are slightly pricey  but tasty and well worth it. The menu will have you bartering with friends (you get ____, I'll give you some of my ____) and planning on future visits. I had the Karadjordjeva and it was delicious.  I planned on trying their desserts (which sound amazing) but I was too full.   Go here. You won't regret it.

re5R6pR4AJkOjWKQc0QgiQ.text: Great food and atmosphere! Super friendly staff! Service was a little slow but only due to the fact that this place gets packed!!

sx2f0C-ar7JzCKQHUXUl0Q.text: Good food, cool atmosphere, outdoor seating and drink specials!  Check it out...

qydE1yNn4PpUGtk1lECNbA.text: I really want to like this place.  I've been before and remember the pizza being okay.  I ordered something that closely resembled hamburger helper with cheese sauce.  I really didn't care that it looked like that, but I did care that it was frozen in the middle.  The  adult beverage was lackluster as well.  I really wished that someone would have checked back to see if I was enjoying my meal.

_FSp7g1YSXupGMRUEHQRUw.text: Agree- decent food for a decent price. The fun thing about Intermezzo is that it has a cozy, laid back international feel to it.   The inside is small so big groups will have to sit outside.

vjh1FJHAWzeZd6QYY3gPZQ.text: I am a regular. I particularly love the pizza, the steak sandwich, and the eggplant musaka. They create marvelous bread in their wood-fired oven! In addition, an amazing meal can be had when ordering the Friday/Saturday night dinner special--all for a reasonable price. I've been blown away by beef short ribs and root veggies (and introduced to roasted radishes). I've had a bone-in pork chop worthy of happy tears. Others are probably glad for the occasional seafood weekend specials. But there's always a great option on the menu if it isn't a weekend night or the special isn't for you. I love that I can order a good beer or a nice glass of wine or a well mixed Manhattan and be pleased by any choice. Though the wine and beer lists aren't extensive, they have been well selected. Martinis are a specialty. Maybe the best thing here, whether in the cozy, exposed brick interior or on the large patio, is the staff. I am always made to feel so welcome here.

1iG1huXvzqNPdeVS7WRz0A.text: Very good pizza and very unique. You need to try this place at least once. The only downsides are that it's a little small on the inside, and while they have a large outdoor seating section, it's at a busy intersection so it can get very loud at times.

snFV3ek5R-kzz4dXoAd9Ew.text: Easy to miss if you're not paying attention (and if there's no one seated outside, which is rare in the warmer months).  Small place; perhaps "cozy" is the right word.  Table are comfortably spaced, there's just not many of them.  When they've got the patio open they probably at least double their seating.  I would say the restaurant has character, it's a unique spot.  Service is basically fine, though once or twice they seemed perhaps a little overwhelmed.  They maintained a good attitude, in any case.  The pizzas seem quite good to me, by current Charlotte standards: flavorful with fresh ingredients and a tasty, thin crust (wood fired?).  My frequent dining companion says good things about some soup they have, I think it's chicken and pesto (and I didn't know you could reasonably use pesto as a soup ingredient).  Another well-traveled friend did not have such high recommendation for their kebobs, unfortunately; I think he would describe them as "run of the mill at best."  I will continue to visit this restaurant, on the strength of the pizza alone.

04ImJ-bYZ56uRwb30DZd2w.text: Best pizza and Serbian food.  The owner and service are outstanding.  Try the homemade Sharma!

HB5XRdEByFCVIIJog87B3w.text: I visited this establishment using my groupon.  The service was horrible I have never met such rude people.  I ordered an 20 oz and they brought me a 16oz glass with a 4 glass on the side and told me they are out of glasses and I accepted that.  The icing on the cake was when we ordered dessert it was the worst piece of crap I've ever tasted in my whole entire life.  I informed the waitress she went and told the manger, she returned telling me he is not going to remove from my bill.  I asked to see the manager she told me no, so I went looking for him.  I found him at the bar making drinks this guy basically confronts me saying I altered my order because I didn't want hazelnut cream on my dessert, therefore I cannot get a refund.  His rude a** then proceeds to over talk me not allowing me to get a word in.   Word of advise please do not eat @ this establishment unless you want to be treated like s***.   I guess that is how they do in Serbia

pr7BlMCthalNyAhyFFx-_w.text: if you like carbs this is the best place you can go. practically everything on the menu is bread and cheese based. everything is so good. best way to describe it is just good mediteranean style foods. italian, greek and eastern europe flavors all mixed together

kJOK0dbfc0QYsGVdMqWWvQ.text: This is more than just another pizza place!!  I am tired of reading reviews calling this spot "another Italian place" for this could not be further from the truth. The owners of this interesting space are actually Serbian and the best dishes on the menu are Eastern European rather than Italian.  I assume most people are making this Italian reference due to the large pizza section on the menu. The pizza is pretty tasty and a good crowd pleaser but the real gems on this menu are the more unusual items. My hands down favorite item  is the Ground Beef Burek. This is house made phyllo dough stuffed with ground beef and onions and served with a cucumber sauce (similar to a chunky tzatziki sauce) and a salad. Now I admit this isn't the first thing that I thought about ordering but the server my wife and I had on our first visit almost insisted we try it. And I am very glad he did!! I am addicted to the Burek and eat it almost once a week! The menu also features a Spinach and Cheese Burek which is also very good. The Sarma (cabbage rolls) are also excellent as are the stuffed peppers. If you want something a bit lighter, the sandwiches, which are served on house made bread and toasted on a wood-fired grill, are great.   You will be hard pressed to find a restaurant in Charlotte with more house-made items, particularly at the price point offered at Intermezzo. Intermezzo makes their own bread, their own Mozzarella, and their own Phyllo dough (if there is another rest aunt in Charlotte making their own phyllo I would be surprised). Another reason this spot sticks out is their use of wood fired ovens, grills and stoves. And this place actually uses wood, rather than just saying it on their menu like some other local pizzerias (particularly ones that start with "B" and end with "xx").   If the food wasn't enough, there is a full bar, a limited but well selected beer and wine list, and some of the best drink specials in town. The only down side is the interior is small and if you are coming with more than 4 people you may have to sit on the patio or in separate booths. However, the awesome food if worth this small annoyance.   If you go to this gem in Charlotte be bold and look past the pizza, and make sure at least one person orders the Burek!!

cFln9WPbf1FhZyy3rqt-Uw.text: Unfriendly waitresses, food just "OK", very slow service, very noisy and smoky on the patio from traffic. We were a big group (10), and 20% of gratuity were automatically added to our check, that's why no efforts were made from the waitresses. I really don't recommend this place.

X5IkUfUQyNNfQTrMZDRN_Q.text: Since I live near this restaurant I really wanted it to be great. It wasn't. In fact, I'll probably never go again. Both of our orders were cold when they were brought out and even if they had been hot, I don't think they would have been that special. The decor our waitress were nice, but the food was sub par. It's a shame since this location changes ownership so frequently, but this place is destined not to last.

q7F_Kaeea5QWvtCLHXLndg.text: Great food w/ Eastern European flair.  In fact, that's where the owner is from.  The patio is the best part with a great view of the skyline.  Great spot for cool casual dining.  Good drink specials.  I love this place...no complaints!

LpI8FM-jaT3vKmP8TfwSwg.text: Excellent pizza, warm neighborhood feeling, friendly staff, casual atmosphere, good variety of beer and tea.  Only had a pizza, but other patrons had attractive plates, so it looks like there is good variety of dishes.  A bit crowded inside, but its a small place and you'd expect a good restaurant to be crowded.  It was too cold to be outside so can't comment on that experience.

nZEm8lykHfE4Sbk-KOw8eg.text: I've enjoyed Intermezzo on each visit.  The Intermezzo Pizza is delicious and they always have great drink specials - harder and harder to find in CLT.  Get to know the owners, they are very accomodating and personable guys.  Especially nice to sit on the covered patio on a lazy afternoon.  Cozy indoor seating as well, TV's included.

omOS0OSqIFiUNs-cVk_AtA.text: I always assumed this was just a pizza place, but it is so much more!  Tasty pizzas as well as some interesting Serbian dishes as well.  There is a nice outdoor seating area, though it is plagued a little by the busy intersection outside.

SmEl82jbpiZK5Lqo_7763g.text: Not a place to take someone on a date.  I was not impressed at all! If YOU desire great food and engaging atmosphere - then this isn't the place. This is sad since they were amazing the first year.   Martini's were half off however it was poorly made, so we put it aside and ordered a different martini.  They charged us for the one they screwed up even though we didn't drink it!  I guess we have no complaints about the hummus since it tasted just like the one we normally get at Trader Joes, but the bread they served... cold and chewy.  Our server gave no eye contact and could care less if the cafe served something bad.  We left and went to the Fig Tree... which the food was amazing and the staff was great!

OSMKb9Y9JW7AqFWhqNDtMA.text: I've been here twice.  The first time I tried through groupon.  There are a ton of great options on the menu.  Both times I have been I have split an appetizer and then gotten one of the Serbian meals.  I have asked on recommendations from the waiter both times and have been very pleased.  Note that the indoor seating is limited, but the outdoor is heated.

Zg2ZFfe1SzFugm32jUOEQg.text: Yeah! for Midwood in Charlotte NC...another great restuarant and this one is my new favorite.  I've eaten there twice in the last week and Nadia from our office has been there three times.  My first visit was a Friday night and the place was full.  We took a seat at the bar and Georgie the bartender was full of energy and personality .... and served us dinner.  I had the Boureck (spelling) which is a ground meat mixture in a pastry crust that was delicious. Served with cucumber sauce and a great little salad.  My boyfriend had the lamb mixture hamburger which is served on a fresh made pita type bread.   His was so big he could barely eat it all.  The next trip we had an appetizer plate of meats and artichoke hearts and cheese.  It looked small but it was delicious.  Then we split the moussaka which was different than any I've ever had.  The eggplant was lightly fried and stacked with a meat blend and a chunky tomato sauce... yummm.   Nadia recommends the grilled veggie sandwich... she said that was the best she's every had! This restaurant is a great addition to a terrific neighborhood.  Oh... if you go on a nice night you can sit outside and have a terrific city light view.

eNXh9aGnmdiBJiaXG7hrrg.text: First let's start off with the service. Waitress Julie B. was awesome. She was very warm and very quick on the welcome. She gave us our menus and our drinks were on the table in seconds. She gave us a little time to check out the menu then came to our rescue to tell us the best things to get. Boy was she ever spot on.   My wife and I started off with the Intermezzo Salad with the balsamic vinaigrette. I don't know about you, but I am not a salad eater, but this salad I could eat all day long. The sweet vinaigrette, and the home made mozzarella really set that badboy off. Julie then ran off a list of her favorite items until we told her to stop at the pizza. We ordered half capriccioso and half intermezzo, and from then on it was nothing but lip smacking and finger lickin. I have had pizzas in NY, Chicago, SF and plenty of other places in the US, but this little corner restraunt in Charlotte is the best I have ever tasted. I'm not just saying this, try it for yourself. The crust was perfect;y crispy and not too thin, nor too thick. They make the dough by hand, and all of the ingredients are fresh. You can taste the freshness as if you were in the garden when they pick  the basil and tomatos. After we downed the pizza it was dessert time. We got the crepe with bananas, strawberrys, and hazelnut choclate sauce and that immediately put me in heaven and didn't want to come down.   If you haven't been to this little hole in the wall spot, then please go. You will be back. You will find yourself forgetting about Papa John's.

-MhAODcQ70r8q09YLdEtxA.text: My first visit to Intermezzo was a few months ago because LaurynC wanted to give it a try. Well I am sold! We went back again the following weekend for a girl's night and it was just as good as the week before. On Saturdays they have  1/2 price martinis...you can't beat that! Everyone at the table had something different off the menu and everyone was more than happy with their choices. I will say the goat cheese appetizer and the corn dip appetizer were both amazing...we got them both weekends. Of all the places I have eaten in Charlotte, this place has one of the best atmospheres. It is so warm and welcoming inside and I can't wait to sit out on the patio this spring. Oh and definitely try the mint chocolate chip martini...I had it for dessert and it was AMAZING!

W-EHwhnSLuaiH-SP9YIdjg.text: Thanks to Yelp, I stumbled upon this place. Reading the great reviews of this place on Yelp, made me have great expectations.  Not to mention the fact that if this place was not as great as it was hyped on Yelp, my friends would have killed me or made me pay for the food. I must say that the place lived upto the Yelp's  reviews.  Ambiance was great, very casual.  Good music... Good service,  the server (who was great, very excited about this job)  suggested 2  pizzas, both of them, were  AWESOME !!  So thanks for the server..  We had chicken florentine (without bacon) and  Garden Fresh. The pizza were great,  made us think why we order Pizzahut pizza.  I found this place to be better than Brixxx.  They do home delivery in 3 mile radius, too bad, I dont live in that radius.   The crowd was also good .. not noisy ...  there was a waiting for a place indoor.  Do not visit this place,  you might cause to this place to get famous and make it crowded ....  just kidding ... do visit.  it is nice place.

tBkm0wNzIdmwDgK6k4dIfg.text: Like the neighbourhood joint, but better.   A solid, Italian-ish menu (everyone seems to rave about the lasagne, but I am a huge fan of the portabello stack) and an incredible service staff (seriously, we don't go in often - every few months, at best - and the servers always comment on our last visit and follow up about whatever it was we chatted about on the previous) make it a place that is worth adding to your rounds.   Cosy, friendly, and delicious. What more are you looking for?

vSDCzEVif-T7EKzD_koRkg.text: Nice ambience. Friendly staff.  Fantastic food.  1/2 price Martini's.  What else could you ask for?!  The menu said the food is Serbian and since I've never had Serbian food (nor could I point out Serbia on a map), my friend suggested I try a dish.  I ordered the Spinach and Cheese Burek and was extremely pleased.  It's enormous and comes with a delightful side salad made of mixed greens... scrumptious.  Their homemade filo dough was the lightest and fluffiest ever, coupled with warm warm spinach and cheese... this dish definitely brought a smile to my face.  I went on a Saturday night so the martini's were 1/2 priced (originally they range from $8-10).  I had a dirty martini (yummy!), a Pink Lady (very strong and made with tequila), a Pamarita (pomegranate... two thumbs up) and the Espresso Martini (I still have dreams about this one).  I also recommend the Mint Chocolate Chip martini which tastes like ice cream.  Of course when I went we were on a girls night out so it was a perfect place but I also recommend visiting this place for date night or when you're just looking for someplace cool to hang.  It's not too loud, the lighting is a little moody and the staff is very friendly.  This is a must visit in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Woodfire Grilled Fungi

MkCcHZdJJFdADSZ2gVhQMA.text: We went there for dinner over the weekend. Drove over 40 min. Heard great things about it. The food was very blah!!! We had a issue with the bill so we asked to see the manager. When she came over was very rude. When we said our complaint she looked at us and said you call me to the table for this? And walked away. I honestly think she had been drinking. Needless to say we won't be back.

Yq5wSSuciXnhnijokT14OQ.text: Fantastic pizza. So, so salad. Attentive and friendly service. Great music. Most of all amazing Pizza. I am from out of town and have been all over the world eating Pizza. This place knows Pizza. Try the Spinach and ricotta cheese. Delish. I would consider moving to Charlotte to eat this pizza once a week. BRAVO!

nLh2NIVQ9X99WhM2ev3KFA.text: Ordered Pizza there last weekend - and sadly they lost a star. While it was better than your local Dominoes or that yucky Papa John's people in NC seem to enjoy ...it wasn't as good as Hawthornes or even Fuel in my opinion. The sauce was kind of bland-could have used garlic or something and truthfully the cheese pizza lacked cheesiness. Instead of being gooey and melty - it kind of seemed too baked on. I'd go here for the Serbian fare but no pizza for me next time.

F4Yc_o3JME5s0O4fpwzcxw.text: We really enjoyed having lunch at Intermezzo.  It's a rather small place, not fancy, but we were really happy with the food.  It seemed very fresh & homemade, not like they opened a can or a jar and served it to us.  We ordered chicken soup (very good and not salty...I HATE salt!), a small funghi pizza (excellent), beef burek (pretty good), which came with a small salad, eggplant moussaka (good, not great), and pork schnitzel (very good).  It was exactly what we were looking for on this occasion, but in all honesty, I wouldn't say I'd go too far out of my way to return.

ShHAzklJqrJXiIgvxPWcKA.text: Good chill place in Plaza Midwood.  Casual with indoor and outdoor seating.  Good lighting and TV's for game days!  Had Grilled Vegetable Pasta and took our server's recommendation on the Sarma (Cabbage Rolls).  Loved it all.  Many other items on the menu looked really good (including the pizza)!  Look forward to going back to try more!

BfsuLXzYM7IdC_c7x6I1OQ.text: Tried for the first time last night after reading all the great reviews. I must say I was not disappointed. My boyfriend and I started out with a margarita pizza which we loved. They even make the mozzarella cheese in house. For dinner I ordered the Beef Burek and my boyfriend ordered Karadjordjeva. While I loved my food and the flaky philo dough my boyfriend def out ordered me. His food was amazing with ham and cheese wrapped in pork all breaded and topped with a tartar sauce. It was so cheesy and wonderful we will definitely  order it again. Our waiter was also awesome. This is now my new fave in charlotte.

px5h245j44u_a2bRjDpBxQ.text: Tasty food. I love the artwork on the walls are for sale too! Such a bohemian, warm atmosphere!  HORRIBLE parking lot size and navigation.

Ku72TsLDXle7GEfza1fthw.text: Awesome place!  A hidden gem packed with character and charm.  Great food and the best martini you'll find in town.

rXVpffyO4lByHD1KJLkWiA.text: Absolutely love this place. I always get the chicken florentine pizza which is out of this world! Everything is always fresh the crust is amazing. They have pretty good drink specials and the waiter is always nice & welcoming. I dine here at least once a week otherwise I would be dreaming about intermezzo's! Me and a friend recently tried something different & it was equally amazing as well

x6_aqThk_1oOceGuayokBg.text: I had a very unpleasant experience at Intermezzo.    The first item I ordered was the Portabello Tower.  It was good; however, nothing about it resembles a tower; more like a short stack.    Next, I ordered the Gouda Burger.  The flavor was decent but the pita bread bun made it hard to keep the sandwich together and about one-quarter into my meal I bit down on a piece of wood.  The waitress initially attributed it to them grounding their own meat; I didn't follow her logic.  I tried to give the burger one more try before I bit down on some gristle and decided I could take no more.   My side of roasted potatoes tasted like they were roasted a week earlier so I had it replaced with a salad with balsamic vinaigrette.  The vinaigrette tasted like olive oil; there was no hint of balsamic vinegar or spices.   The waitress came back and explained that the wood was from the wood grill they cooked the burger on. Ah-ha!  That makes sense but it's still disgusting and the owners may want to consider replacing their grill.  By the way, they did not charge me for the burger.    My sister ordered the veggie lasagna.  It was edible but very bland.    At any rate, I left very dissatisfied, nauseous and determined to never eat at Intermezzo again.

t62-3uGjD3thp4v1dfc8pA.text: Good pizza and decent service.  Would've enjoyed more refills on water...but overall friendly service.  Really enjoyed the spinach supreme pizza!  Price was reasonable for the quality of food and atmosphere of the restaurant.

zeaPP-lpx67VHT5RvkV4BA.text: One of our favorite go-to restaurants! Tyler is the absolute best server in Charlotte... the food is amazing, comforting and all homemade!

NtKBz60y6xN8iWd-rn65IQ.text: New vegetarian here. It's been difficult to find good food that meets the need. Intermezzo made it easy, their veggie lasagna and garlic knots hot the spot!

m997x3tF509l3asNIxouNQ.text: Cool little place with somewhat cool vibe. Not too impressed with the food or service though.

ixRzTEj9lRTC8NYOryMxcw.text: I almost don't want to write this review so that this place stays a hidden gem, but they deserve the praise.   Intermezzo is open late. The service is great and friendly (but not hovering). The food is amazing, especially the Serbian section. Try the:  Steak sandwich Sarma Burek  Piroska  The restaurant is quiet and cozy, with a big patio if you want to sit outside. Did I mention that they always have great music playing? What more could you want?

_HKlEenh929GshK9zU-NkQ.text: Ordered online and was very disappointed as compared to dinning in person. Bolognese was a smaller portion, and the lasagna was tiny and drenched in sauce to cover it up. The bread sticks which typically are good were hard, greasy, cold and covered in an insane amount of garlic. Honestly it feels like they forgot about the order and through something together quickly and grabbed old bread sticks. We threw a majority of the meal away and are unsure if we'll return.

Ob7DJ_kvNytRdYNkwwaZ4w.text: When we first moved to charlotte a year ago this restaurant felt like a hidden gem. The food was great, cool atmosphere. Since then, each trip to the restaurant or online order has been progressively more disappointing. The majority of the wait staff is visibly irritated with customers and is inattentive even on a night when the restaurant is basically empty. On one occasion, we took company there and our waitress came to the table maybe twice the whole night. She forgot to put in a dessert we ordered to go so we sat for close to 20 minutes waiting while she stood in the back on her phone. I finally asked someone else and they couldnt find the order. Another time we ordered online and the bartender gave our friends attitude when he couldnt locate the order despite a confirmation email and a name given. Seemed annoyed to have to do his job. The hostess has been unhelpful and unfriendly on several occasions. There seems to be a pattern of genuinely good food being ruined by staff who just doesnt care and treats people like crap. I really hope the manager/owner does something about this.

xhFaSOMrZthHWY15f-yvRQ.text: I love this spot! I've been here twice now and the bruschetta as an appetizer is a MUST! The first time I went I ordered pizza and I really enjoyed it and my friend had the infamous ravioli and she raved about it for weeks. Recently, I had the blackened chicken pasta and it was amazing-- I haven't had a pasta that cheesy and creamy in a long time-- definitely made my night. I also ordered tiramisu- though I might add that it wasn't really my favorite. It was not as moist as I expected and was a bit flavorless. Other than that, I enjoyed my time at Intermezzo!

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. YUMMY! Blackened chicken pasta
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best bruschetta in town!

IyFkmZmUJftR4dYY-ds0CA.text: What a cozy place with really good food. The service was friendly and extra nice. Sarah was so nice that we can't wait to go back.  We had the grilled eggplant and burek.  Delicious.

Ztvo7vM8F53FqMgnmAtRPw.text: Cute spot in Plaza Midwood. The food was alright, nothing to rave about. I had the Roasted red pepper bruschetta and I would say it had too many red peppers on it, but that was my fault for ordering. The staff was friendly and the music was a good mix of throwbacks.

TZzfiX2jAWQm2VJSvEki1A.text: We were charged an absurd $10 for buttered spaghetti noodles and grilled chicken with no vegetables after being assured, "we don't have a kid's menu, but we can make her something for kids, no problem." This was $3.95 less than their specialty schnitzel my wife ordered. I was already $1.50 extra in on my beer because they didn't have any Blue Moon, but "would you like to try this $5.50 one we have on tap"? When they eventually got around to bringing our dinner, they managed to bring my two-year-old daughter the wrong pasta at first... when they took it away, she responded exactly how you'd expect a hungry two-year-old to respond. Thanks. $50 and an utterly uninspiring chicken francese later, we won't be going back.

Wm2bJy6b76ity5ti5E0TUA.text: I will break it down, but in terms of service, food, and atmosphere this place was great! I would recommend it to anyone.   My dad and I went here one night because we love to try out the restaurants featured on DDD. We were confused and intrigued by the combination of Italian and Serbian, but willing to give it a try.   In terms of the split, they have a list of apps that pull from both cuisines. Then a list of about 10 pizzas - which were freakin' amazeballs, we got the capriccioso - a handful of Serbian entrees (we are Armenian so that was a real treat), a list of about 5 different pasta dishes, and an EXTENSIVE "martini" list. The martinis are really just cocktails, but still delicious in their own right. On the consumables front they get straight A's.   Also, our waiter Steve was so great. He went above and beyond great customer service and genuinely seemed enthusiastic about working there. He also was the perfect balance of helpful, attentive, and giving us some space. I'm not sure if all the wait staff is of the same caliber, but either way the food is more than worth it.   The only down side I would say is that it is very small. We went pretty late on a Wednesday evening, so we didn't have to worry much about crowds. But I can definitely see this place filling up quickly on Saturdays for the $5 martini special.

w4OyNj4Oqn5YugCXk5T1Pg.text: I can give you many reasons to stay away.  From the food to the service to the cleanliness of the establishment.   Really much better places to spend your money.

e2fNDBo2Ig-SCilQYbpSSw.text: Went here for a late dinner, and it was a really nice surprise!    The establishment was beautifully decorated/integrated into the original brick building, and the ambience was similar to some of the culinary gems I've stumbled across in Europe.  The music was kind of an eclectic mix of smooth electronic/trip hop, (Think Massive Attack, Zero Seven, Beats Antique, ect...) and a nice compliment to the overall Euro vibe they had going on.    Our waiter was very friendly too, and knowledgeable about the Serbian food selection.  I ended up choosing the stuffed peppers, and they did not disappoint!  The use of yellow bell peppers and a sweet and tangy pepper sauce made the dish light and refreshing. Stuffed peppers can be heavy sometimes if the balance of ground beef, rice, and veggies is off, but Intermezzo's proportions were perfect.  Presentation was beautiful too, and the serving size generous enough to not think twice about spending $15 on an entree.   Will definitely be back again, as they've got a pretty chill bar setup, and raving reviews for their sarma!

KqnvIEnApqSbR0DF19_JHQ.text: My favorite restaurant in Charlotte!!! I love the steak sandwich, and the salad. THe balsamic vinaigrette is the best I have ever had.  The martinis are to die for, my favorite is the astropop. My last visit I had the chicken Alfredo pizza, and it was beyond superb.  Home made crust, fresh tomatoes, bacon, so sooooo good.  I love Trey to death he is the best waiter in the Queen City!!

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Alfredo pizza
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Astropop

3GaV2_G_J_CdJ6H8Hn9rwQ.text: This place is fantastic.  Food is outstanding and service is excellent.  Stuffed cabbage is to die for.  Lasagna, pizza, chicken dishes are wonderful.  They have an excellent selection of craft beers, as well as a nice wine list.  This was my first  visit, it  certainly won't be the last.  Well behaved dogs are allowed on the patio, which is very nice for those within walking distance.

dWrI1WZoAGKMWnY5vXwVfw.text: This edition of "Excited about Eating" takes us back to the Plaza-Midwood neighborhood of Charlotte, to a restaurant recently featured on Food Network's "Diners, Drive ins and Dives," Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe. This European style restaurant serves hand-tossed pizza and traditional Serbian dishes. It reminded me of some of the cafes we visited on our past trips to Europe. Dora here. Yeah, especially the cozy interior with brick exposed walls and only a smattering of tables and booths surrounding a hearth-like bar. But they don't need many interior tables with this generous outdoor patio! After DDD's feature, I was all set to order the cabbage rolls (Sarma), but they were out. So, at the waiter's helpful recommendation, I ordered Karadjordjeva, a ham and cheese schnitzel breaded and pan fried, served with skillet potatoes and tartar sauce, although not the typical American tartar sauce, with a definite hint of dill. Similar to Cordon Bleu, but elevated a few notches, especially with the drizzle of lemon on the top. Dora here. I ordered the Burek, ground beef and onions baked in Fillo dough. An unusual combination, right? But isn't it beautiful? Nothing spicy or too complex. After a few bites what came to mind was comfort food, much like Mac 'n Cheese is to Americans. Between Ernie and I, we finished off the whole thing. Didn't touch the salad, but that cucumber mixture made for a nice dipping sauce. I'd definitely order the Karadjordjeva again, but I'd also like to try the Sarma or the Piroska. And the pizza... Dora here. Guess that means we'll be going back. lol We rate this restaurant 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food. Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog bit.ly/1Khw9dO

Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Karadjordjeva
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Exterior

gyiiN8l1T6a7RSUg25Vhww.text: This place has pretty good pizza... not New York good, but pretty amazing for Charlotte.  Our server was super friendly and helpful. The food came out in under 10 min which was really impressive.  I will say that with the large amount of plastic covers, the place looks a bit cheap... and I didn't have an SUV, I wouldn't feel totally comfortable parking in its lot.

-0BHgGnTVmWBAvmOiFu4XQ.text: I have been wanting to try out Intermezzo for a while now and finally had the opportunity. I must say that I was not sure what to order since many of their dishes have either beef or pork. But after checking out some Yelp reviews, I decided to try the veggie lasagna. This was definitely a good choice! The lasgna was delicious and the portion size was just right - not ginormous. I loved the fresh-tasting tomato sauce and the veggies & noodles were perfectly cooked. After seeing the reviews that mentioned dessert, I decided to splurge and try the crepes for dessert. The strawberries & bananas in hazelnut chocolate sauce were so tasty! On my visit the service was fast & efficient. On.my way out, I walked by a table that had ordered pizza and it really looked good! I may have to try one of their pizzas on my next visit!

4HeXJaxp00sOw3ogyijkzg.text: Bolognese all damn day. Also really love everyone that works here and eats here. Cool crowd, somewhere you want to be.

BT-rtKg6IsDHFt0orqsaGw.text: Loved it. Took the kids on a circus and a dinner date. Using Groupon. The food was fantastic .The service stellar. The kids had pizza and gobbled it all up like it was the last pizza on earth. I had the Moussaka and I was in heaven. I love moussaka and it can be wrong in so many ways. BUT I was not disappointed it was lovely an creamy bechamel. Just a wonderful dish. My family felt welcome and enjoyed themselves.  I can't wait to explore more of that menu.

1mxdehz4M0TeNVrqgV4iCA.text: Okay, so I was skeptical about this place when we moved to Plaza Midwood 2 years ago.  We tried to eat there twice, but have up because each time the wait was ridiculously long and it didn't feel like it was worth it. Then one night, we decided to order take-out.  Holy moly!!! Best decision ever.  Take-out is almost never as good as when the food is served fresh in front of you, but everything we ordered was phenomenal!  I had pasta carbonara, which was really good.  We have ordered pizza and/or pasta from here several times since then, and each time the food has been spot on!  Surprisingly awesome place, highly recommended!

_-2Qv6UlW90N6ZiqYvSTCg.text: I've been a few times over the past years and Im always impressed with the service and food. We were celebrating a birthday and started out at a booth but people kept joining us and we had to add chairs. The server was accommodating and friendly, never made us feel we were asking too much. I've tried several things on the menu but now I always order the ground beef burek. It's so delicious!! A Serbian dish with ground beef and onions, wrapped in phyllo dough. It came with cucumbers in a tzatiki sauce and a small salad. Heavenly. If you want an appetizer the bruchetta is always a hit, and I also recommend the crepes for dessert.

6WcdeEDpv_1bpf2Teovz3A.text: We've been going to Intermezzo for almost as long as they've been open. The food is outstanding - made fresh daily and always delicious! Added bonus, it's a family owned restaurant and they get to know their customers. The owners, Serbian brothers Branko and Djordje, are extremely friendly and welcoming. Trey has been our server from the beginning and has become like extended family to us. It's hard to find gems like Intermezzo!

eLeRfzFajkVy1MUBw3Ysfg.text: Came here with our 3rd coupon this year! Yay! This time Google Offers.  Had the Ricotta and Goat Cheese Crostini again as an appetizer, still yummy!  This time I ordered the House-Made Ravioli... AMAZING!  Dense raviolis. Strong sun-dried tomato flavor, very cheesey, rich but fresh marinara. I Highly recommend this dish, you won't be disappointed.  Ordered dessert this time around. The Crepes... I DIE. bananas and strawberries inside, nutella-like drizzle outside (but with white chocolate too?).  ORDER THE CREPES!   Still wish the prices were a little lower.

B_2Kd9DdrbbkcepeN-3Gyw.text: This restaurant is excellent!!  My husband and I have heard about it and decided to try it on the way to a show at Knight's Theatre.  He had the stuffed cabbage and I had the blackened chicken with vegetables.  OMG it was wonderful!!  The homemade pasta is to DIE for!!!  The atmosphere was great, our waiter was the best!!  I can't wait to go back again!!  I highly recommend this place for a nice dinner, pizza etc.

Ncxopo-QJAKgdZd8QEWxCA.text: Loved the food! We sat on the patio. I was a little afraid all of the traffic noise would take away from our experience but it did not. Our waiter was awesome! My bfs son talks sports all day. The waiter always had a witty come back and kept him entertained. The pizza is huge and delish! We shall return!

7LNpbhCrKwrEF0zaz9hTUA.text: Best pizza I've had in Charlotte, I can't believe I hadn't tried it before. Had the Margherita pizza, the ingredients and veggies tasted quality and very fresh. My favorite part was the bread. Also had the garlic twists which were also very good. Christina was our server and she was super attentive and friendly. Great little spot, will definitely be back for more.

jv8MiMoPxRPidRSQd_pKwA.text: I have been here a couple of times and the first time I got the Cajun chicken pasta. It was really good and flavorful. Came with broccoli and onions mixed in. The second time I got it, they didn't have the onions in it which I thought was weird. We sat in the closed patio area and service was very slow. Literally took 5 mins for our drink order and another 10 mins for our actual order. I think the server had tables inside and outside the patio. Drinks were never filled or asked if we wanted more drinks at the bar. Food took forever, over 30 mins. Other than that, the food is good for the most part and depending on your server, you might get good or bad service.

otwt-pheofpL74pBF7zvUg.text: Great casual restaurant "downtown" but out of the way in a thriving neighborhood. Enjoyed sitting at the bar and chatting with one of the co-owners, Broncho, who brought recipes from Serbia to share. I was very comfortable and well sated without feeling stuffed at all.

Hw3uI4xLm59awfSYe6pdAA.text: We have returned to Intermezzo a few times and the Serbian dishes are very good.  The beef burek is very good.  Think of it is a flaky calzone with perfectly seasoned ground beef.  I have also tried the stuffed cabbage (sarma) which was very good.  Additionally, the sandwiches are very good since they make their own bread.   I highly recommend this place and it is reasonably priced too.

P0slnQEB5TbyvLibvjBm-g.text: I have been coming here for years!!  Great mix of eastern european food and the stuffed cabbages are just like my dad makes:)  They are full of flavor and taste just like Romanian Sarmale.

kjpGVwem3KMDbM-wF5udHw.text: Great pizza and atmosphere. Their specialty is Serbian food, which we didn't try but sounded good. They had $3 Birdsong beers which was nice. Service could have been better. I would come back!

x-zkYMSYKiSbJq71enuq_A.text: I haven't been here in years, and I don't know why. We went for lunch, and Kevin was the only one serving, which made me a little nervous. He did an unbelievable job bouncing from section, from inside to patio, and from dining room to bar.  The best part of our experience was the food. The fungi  mushroom pizza was phenomenal, and our appetizer was good too.  The only thing missing was a little ambiance, it felt like a dead restaurant which amazed me with how fresh everything was

LCffCJLmuQy-BU4Q34ypCg.text: Amazingly great pizza, ambient indoor atmosphere for a cold winter's eve.  This place is probably hopping in the summer on the patio!

-TLEL9Q2NhV4Dck_3Sv2sA.text: Amazing and authentic sarma, Karadjordjeva and burek.. will be back without a question!

oUBSH8WnD6U0manhrV8geA.text: Thank goodness they deliver! I've only had pizza delivered from here, but it's been the best pizza I've had in a long time. They have just the right balance of toppings, cheese and sauce and the crust is soft and chewy. The Chicken Florentine pizza is my fave. I'm looking forward to eating in the restaurant sometime too.

QFuHARjmHq-FdVMtGYya-g.text: We were looking for a place on a Sunday night and noticed this was one of the only places open, thank God!  Pizza was excellent. Service was very good. Would definitely like to return for the Serbian food, sounds as good as the pizza!

U9Kz-YHqUMZD28i8MAEcFg.text: Used my Groupon ticket here - picked it up on a whim and it was well worth it.  Ordered the special of the day - Chicken, Shrimp, Chicken, Mussels, Andouille Sausage on Saffron Rice cooked with Peppers.  My friend ordered the veggie lasagna.  I didn't try his veggie lasagna, bc we were already eating dinner together and it seemed fruity to do so! I'm insecure ;]  Food was delicious.  It tasted very good and served in reasonable portions.  It definitely had a home-cooked feel to it which for some reason always hits the belly a little better than "restaurant" food.  It was like fireworks going off in my mouth - the way the melange of flavors were distinct, yet blended well.  One word to describe it would be: Elegant - defined as "simple but genius"  Service was attentive and informative.  I didn't even finish my diet Coke, I mean, Coke Zero (manlier) and server had my next one ready (kinda just had to drink it bc it was prepared)  How did this place miss out on 5 stars?  Dishes were slightly overpriced. Slight meaning like $1 or $1.50 overpriced.  Will I come here again? Absolutely.  I recommend it highly as it is a perfect blend of home-cooked and deliciousness.  Parking lot sucks - it's gravel ;/  dmo out

kY7gMb2myRzdXGy0Ym35IQ.text: I've been to this restaurant 3 times and each time has had a negative experience. I don't know if the employees are just rude, racist, or socially awkward. Even when I called to order the male host seemed to be bothered with my questions.There were also problems with my order on two occasions. The first time they gave me a severely burnt pizza and when I complained I got major attitude from one of the male host. The second time they forgot to add pepperoni to my pizza and had to wait an additional 20 minutes for them to correct it; with no apology! It's really unfortunate because the restaurant is within walking distance from my house.

nkTg9I3hCqWlgMBkp9I-aw.text: Excellent attentive service, well poured quality cocktails at a great price and no shortage of quality menu options and my favorite pizza crust in town. It's my go to date night / double date spot.

y7n9-2ySjCQDn4g3WJyuaQ.text: This is my new local pizza (and other bites) and drinks spot! Recently moved into the hood and love this place! Bartenders and servers are the best and the food is great! Trey is the best, love him!!! The patio and a rum coke is my jam!

YcnzGoq0wTeh3SQttsAiMQ.text: Been to this place few times and the pizza has never gone wrong!  Haven't really tried most part of the menu, somehow in the mind Intermezzo stands as a pizza place and just that.  Should try other items on the menu, for sure.But again, the pizza has never gone wrong.  Pizza crust, flavor, toppings, quality and quantity - everything is on point.  Service is good, sometimes there is just only one person who does all the work so service might be a little slow.  There is no welcome desk or anything like that, you can enter the place and find any table you like to sit and the server comes to you to take order.  After you enter and looking for someone to show you the table (if its your first time to Intermezzo), they just holler at you to "sit anywhere you like".  Wife & I just "extra" spoiled ourselves by walking to Two Scoop Creamery for a scoop(x3) of ice cream after relieving our guilt pleasure with a large Veggie & Chicken pizza at Intermezzo.

vGLFxm_w3Weo06oTg2usng.text: Had a great meal here after not having been for a long time. The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable, service is great and food is really good. It's clear why this has been a neighborhood staple for so long!

B0NNNXQbZoY201qrDYGfgw.text: My favorite restaurant in Charlotte, period. It's become a staple for date night, and I just got my best friend hooked as well. I haven't had anything that wasn't delicious -- the spinach and cheese burek, pizza, ravioli, salad, goat cheese crostini are all notable. Corn dip is next on the list to try. Service is always on point, too!  Best of all, they deliver. We live 3.5 miles away, so not too far, but that's at least a point of reference. Not sure what their full delivery area radius is.  For a dessert-y nightcap, try the chocolate martini. Scrumptious.

RfzdHcLWm050rxpEkfQQAg.text: Love Intermezzo, the food is amazing, service is great and we love going there with friends! The atmosphere is laid but and the smells when you walk in with slap you with deliciousness (is that a thing?! If not, it is now!)

mmccsWQc4vAgmJultSWq5g.text: I've heard many great things about Intermezzo but I actually wasn't overly impressed when we went. We grabbed a seat on the patio - it was fairly quiet for a Tuesday night.  We started with the portabello mushroom tower. It was somewhat of a disappointment in portion size - for $9, you get a tiny serving with maybe 2 mushrooms. The goat cheese is delicious but I don't think this was worth the money.  We wanted to try True Serbian cuisine. I got the Becka Snicla (Wienerschnitzel) - Breaded Pork Tenderloin, Skillet Potatoes, Creamed Spinach. The spinach was a little too peppery, and the pork tenderloin was rather dry. I think it needed a slice of cheese or some marinara sauce. It was also lukewarm in temperature, as if it had been sitting out for a while. My husband got the Piroska (Balkan Style Stuffed Pizza), which was much better than my dish. It is very similar to a calzone, and stuffed with ricotta and mozzerella cheese and with sour cream on top. Our waitress wasn't overly friendly either.  Overall, I'm pretty disappointed by the experience here, and not sure I would recommend it!

B80jL6IJCcVZrzT1kQ9-xg.text: We just stopped in here for lunch. It was a slow time in the day so we were told to sit anywhere we liked. The service was attentive and quick. I had the blackened chicken pasta. My husband had the cabbage rolls. Both were amazing. I stole a bit of the fresh made pita that came with the cabbage rolls to sop up the wonderful sauce that covered my pasta. I didn't want to waste a drop. It was everything we expected and more. We will definitely be back. I would like to try the recommended pork chops and work through the pizza menu.

RJQbcnoFaZMy9d9oGy46bQ.text: Delicious pizza! Andrew was great, seated quickly, got a meat lovers pizza, the 10" was just a bit much- had three pieces left over and if I want traveling I would have taken it with me. Loved the crust.

71qSbHG7O_yFg2OdSt0CTA.text: Still 5 star quality.  I ordered eggplant moussaka like always and had it delivered to me.  It's not a cheap meal, but it is sooo delicious.  Upon opening it, I noticed it was a very tiny portion, which is NOT usual.  I have been ordering here for 7 years, and have never had this issue.  I called just to let them know it was a little disappointing, but still delicious.  The owner drove BACK to my house herself and delivered another one free of charge.  You never get quality service like that anymore.  I was so thrilled and surprised.  My favorite place in Charlotte still, now even more.  They truly care about their customers.

9klyPwBSIWKo0Far047sYg.text: 2Delicious food.  Terrific service.  Will definitely be back.  Great vegetarian options.

NSlTeuhds8gosqdnDOYwjw.text: Intermezzo is a small, intimate restaurant with a steady cast of bartenders/servers.  You feel like you're walking into a friend's restaurant each time you walk through the door.  There is a small bar that seats 10 or fewer - this is my favorite place to sit - a patio that is heated in the winter and then a dining room with a small nook near the bar.  It's a unique and charming venue.  While many people (including me, sometimes) order the pizza at Intermezzo, their Serbian food is really where the menu shines.   Going in, you should be aware that this is not light food - it's hearty, stick with you, comfort food.   The piroska is outstanding - essentially a Serbian calzone.  The becka snickla - pork tenderloin cutlet with potatoes and creamed spinach - is so very tasty.  I recommend spreading the creamed spinach - which I could eat by the bucketful - on the pork tenderloin.  I also recommend the eggplant musaka - ask for an extra side of the marinara - it's addictive.  I really don't think you can go wrong - and, if you're not sure, just ask your server - they're very knowledgeable and helpful.  The bar offers a few wines by the glass and about about 8 beers on tap that rotate.  If you're going to have more than 4 people, call ahead and see about reserving a table.

ssrqWydmvQcu3d9G2Ks8Fg.text: Freakin' fantastic put this on your list of places to try. Food is fresh and delicious and they have a good selection of mixed drinks.

V1LZ92G-QnymxKnjVVphkg.text: Had the blackened chicken pasta and everything about it was very good, especially the sauce. It had a more robust and smoky flavor than many similar pastas that I have had. I recommend ordering the house-baked bread to go with it. At $1.50, the spongy pocket bread paired nicely with the pasta. 10/10 would eat again.

0166brhK0XaOXtYanK7xGw.text: I was, unfortunately very disappointed.  Service was not good at all. Waitress stood behind the bar in her phone when not doling out dirty menus and mediocre plates of food. I asked for a Bev nap from the bar and she said I couldn't have one because  they are too expensive but I could have a C fold towel. Can you believe that? Atmosphere is extremely dark and dirty on a bright summer day, yet if you want to sit on the patio you literally have to sit under the heat of the kitchen exhaust fan. It's completely absurd. The food is bland and comes with a blob of aged salad. Tables and seats in the booths are sticky. I can get a burrito with sour cream anywhere (aka Serbian pirotska)  nothing special. Highly do not recommend :(
