kGl2iCfsMUu_VYISKIKmyA.text: OMG!! Can't tell you how many times we've passed this place up for a more comfortable already been to place. Well tonight we took the leap!! And I'll never regret it!! There was maybe 5 people in the place besides staff but the phone rang off the hook for delivery while we were there. Took a little bit  to get our appetizer but then we learned this is truly a farm to table restaurant. Everything is fresh made. They have no freezers in the restaurant. I'm telling you it was the best marinara I've ever had.. for a small place they have a great draft beer list including 2 high gravity ones tonight.. I'm still in awe as to how great our meal was. As for all the triple D places we've ate at in Charlotte.. this one definitely is the best ever!! Hands down!!

oBvFkMATJC4ByyqNks2HWQ.text: Went to here yesterday! Order a 22 inch pizza, what came out, look like a 10 inch. The pizza that they post, and what you get, is like night and day.

cTPZUqujZ68AK-Ui2Dcr7w.text: Lovely little restaurant. Nice outside seating right next to the street. Inside is small but quaint. There is a full bar. It is clear when you get your food that it's home made here and not a chain. We got a supreme pizza. Huge and hand tossed. Fresh toppings enough for 4 and still brought some home  In a past visit we got the Sarma. Served in a light sauce. Wanted it again but was sold out. The becka snicia is very European and also good but order lots of lemons to give it more flavor and moisture  Parking can be a little tough when busy Worth a try, really good food

7wilDErxyg25m6wAMUCpvA.text: I was SO excited to come back here after having moved briefly to AZ for 3yrs.  Being 100% Serbian, I was looking forward a good pivo (beer) to find they now longer serve the Serbian beer and they have drastically changed the menu. This my only reason for the 3 stars but it's important to me . They run their Happy hour until 7 , apps were amazing . We will be back but I want my Serbian Beer!!!!

XzKSx1u2E9bB46fI-TnC-Q.text: I really like Intermezzo we've come here many times and the service is always good and the food is great!! I've had the pizza, pasta, and some of the traditional dishes they offer like stuffed peppers and the stuffed cabbage both are really good- my favorite is the corn dip to start with and the homemade bread it pretty great!!

DiL6q3QY7RpFCjV4-s8XrA.text: Won't be back here ever again. After numerous bad meals, we decided to only go there for drinks -mainly half price martinis on Saturday...we f'd up and came in today (Sunday) craving a martini. We waited TWENTY MINUTES for two drinks. Granted, only one person was working (so we thought) but he didn't even attempt to communicate on the delay until we said something...the worst thing was, a douche started problems with another customer which wouldn't have bothered me(I like a good show) had the TWO MANAGER/OWNERS not magically popped up to argue with the guy! If it was busy enough for our server to be in the weeds, they should've been on the floor helping the staff. just thought that was crap and we decided we wouldn't be back. that is all.

6GGnFIMg5vRM7Ll7oSqunw.text: The menu is very interesting..from pizza to Serbian food, huh. After hearing so many great things about this place, & loving pizza, I had to try it. I went on a Saturday afternoon with my mom. The bartender/server was very friendly. He was as fast as he could be, considering he was the only one on staff. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich w/ grilled veg & my mom got a veg pizza. She let me try some of her pizza, which was quite delectable. I really enjoyed the crunchy crust, no doubt a result of the wood-burning stove. My food on the other hand was not so impressive. I should've gone with my first instinct & ordered pizza, but hey ya live ya learn. The sandwich was average at best, a little on the dry side. The biggest disappointment was the grilled veg. Throwing some zucchini & onion together just doesn't cut it guys.

OQcXyxl7x7lSXwPt0JVVMw.text: A friend and I decided to try this establishment on a rainy friday evening. Parking was iffy but we managed to find a spot. It was nice to see so many patrons. That is always a good sign.  We had to wait just 10 min or so to be seated and my only complaint here is the lack of a comfortable waiting area. Small gripe though. While waiting we were able to watch plenty of food coming out of the kitchen (which looked great) and everyone seemingly having a good time.   We were ultimately led to a small table outside. This is where the service starts to slip. It took far too long for someone to get our drink orders. I think they were just understaffed that night. Moving on...  We couldn't decide what we wanted but finally settled on the goat cheese crostini and a large pizza (I confess I cannot remember which one). The appetizer had great flavor and the bread was clearly made with care. My date liked it so much she ate the crusty edges I discarded.  As for the pizza...fantastic! The crust was nearly perfect with a slightly crispy exterior and a light and chewy interior. The amount of sauce was perfect and it was very fresh tasting and tangy. The cheese and toppings were clearly of above average quality and used appropriately. My date said best pizza she has had in charlotte...but there are others to try. Says a lot that it is her benchmark. I still think Portofinos is its equal if not a different style of pizza altogether.  Will I return? Without a doubt. I want to try some of the Serbian entrees. Yelp did not let me down this time.

BFhdpn8Nxu3uh5CA0yUaxw.text: Wow.. The co-owner of this place is a total jerk. I'm a super regular of this joint being that I live across the street.. If I have an out of towner or wanna go for a chill eve for a drink or two I head over. nEVEr aGAin!! I place an order for take out desert and it was so small I ask for a larger piece. He declined.  If you wanna be ripped off.. Make a visit to intermezzo on central ave.

K5NX-7Qnzho3baBzH7Rqgw.text: Pizza here is top notch, owner is pretty funny, and the chicken francese is off the charts. For some reason I thought ordering grilled eggplant was a good idea, obviously it wasnt, but at least i wasnt too full. Definitely reccomended and I might even feel comfy enough to eat solo at the bar here in the future.

qxIszyjpuBrrqRG2M_SLeg.text: Wonderful family owned neighborhood spot. Great wine selection. A bit casual for a date, but sometimes the not so fancy is nice. Pizza crust is a bit thicker than I like, but very tasty turkey burgers.

ZRz_rytyXncRsSKZI6yvxg.text: Small but quirky place has lots of character and good pizza.  The interior is tiny but cozy, and the bar area is nice.  We sat outside, and while the patio is fairly spacious, it is quite close to the road and intersection. While we were outside, seven police cruisers stormed by, sirens wailing. Kind of indicative of an area that is still in transition maybe.  The pizza and beer were good, and the service was friendly and prompt.  I would definitely visit again.

T1DbId1FrjM86MN0s7wxzw.text: Visited Intermezzo on the recommendation of a friend. Like some other Italian style Charlotte restaurants, this one isn't run by Italians, but Eastern Europeans - which has resulted in a great pizza menu (haven't branched out yet) and some unique offerings, like a Balkan stuffed pizza. I haven't tried it yet - I keep telling myself "next time," but I haven't been able to get away from the mushroom or spinach pizzas. The kabob was only so-so (my husband got it once) but we were back a week or two ago and they've cut it from the menu.   GREAT drink specials on Saturdays (half off their martini list) and Wednesdays (half off mixed drinks, top shelf liquors) and they have some excellent - and varied - choices for beer on draft. Everybody's friendly and the prices are good.  Occasionally there are too many servers, in my experience - they loiter around next to the bar waiting for work. (I have only been here in the winter, though...summer might be a different thing.) Overall, one of my new favorite places for a night out.

g-5pmKa5Atc_-dvMr86VEQ.text: I went there for lunch today after seeing the restaurant on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.  This place definately looked like a dive once I got inside.  Nonetheless, if the food is good, that will overcome the decor.  There were at least 4 open tables in a relatively small restaurant.  As she was talking to another patron, the waitress told me to sit anywhere I wanted.  She promptly took my drink order and after about 10-15 minutes, and again not many patrons in the restaurant, she never came back.  I have limited time for lunch so I had to leave.  I will never go back to this place. There are too many other good restaurants in town that really want new business.  Obviously, this is not one of them.  I eat lunch out every day, and tell everyone that I know my experiences.  I am writing this email to help others avoid wasting their time.

uBToKlKvRbxAppP3q1mTaw.text: I went here years ago and loved it.  After moving back to Charlotte, I went back praying the food was still good.  Intermezzo did not disappoint!  Each dish was excellent and our waitress was totally on her game.  I can't wait to go back.

I6l904rzxaEhkYMEzPnZgw.text: This place is interesting. The patio is beautiful, with a great view of the skyline. It's a little crowded inside, but the patio is big enough to accommodate a great, big family.  The food is good, the price is very reasonable, and you get the whole excitement of Plaza Midwood without the crowds of the Penguin or other places in the same area. I think Brett M.'s word "quirky" is a great word to describe Intermezzo.

FBM2Cy_NC6xlUaH7-So_MA.text: Great service! Great pizza! I get the Fungi every time. Love the cozy atmosphere inside. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. I love that it is family owned and operated too. Support local!

NFnuBe3yui-_3awJCxwANw.text: Pizza is too expensive and doesn't taste like anything special. A tiny piece of tiramisu was close to $7 and doesn't even taste that good. The tiramsu at Carrabba's is cheaper. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

oYJR3biVdv7UuCTFqislkQ.text: We went last Friday after hearing such good things about this place.  It smelled fantastic when we got inside, and the place was packed, so I figured we would be in for a great meal, but I couldn't have been more wrong.  We ordered the roasted red pepper bruschetta as an appetizer.  First thing we noticed were the canned red peppers.  It was obvious they were canned and not fresh.  Fresh ingredients are so easy to prepare and make such a difference.  I am not sure why they would use canned red peppers, but it was disappointing.  Second, the bottom was black.  It was burned bad.  It was basically cheesy bread (same stuff you can get at Dominos) with canned red peppers.  It was awful.  For entrees, I had the Beef Burek and my fiancee had the margherita pizza.  The Burek didn't taste bad, but it was completely boring.  It was dough filled with beef spiced with onions and garlic.  That's it.  No sauce, nothing.  It was horribly dry.  I didn't know if this is how it was traditionally served, since I have never had Burek before, but it was awful as well.  The pizza was probably the best thing we ordered, and even it was terribly bland.  Just no taste at all.  We had to cover it in crushed red pepper just to get some flavor out of it!  We were both pretty upset because we had heard such good things about this place, and everyone else there seemed to be enjoying their meal, but ours was just awful.  Its probably safe to say we will not be returning.

foFjbn6Ua_-hisFN0G8g0g.text: One of my favorite places in Charlotte.  The owners are extremely nice and friendly and the food is excellent! My favorites are the Spinach and cheese borek (although this is the Serbian version of the Greek spanakopita which is what I grew up on), the pizza with Ham & Onion, the bean soup and of course the crepes! Best crepes in CLT! The only thing that they need is more tables and paved and more parking.  Other than that it is a great restaurant.

bnfTt-Yq58EJRoSaseE2ow.text: Had some traditional serbian dishers and the food was really good!  The service was very good and the crepes were delicious!

o16lGOio8cFQwWeW5dq_ng.text: I've been here twice now, and I love this place. The atmosphere is my favorite thing about it. It is a place in which I would enjoy becoming a regular.  The outdoor seating on the front patio is very inviting. The drink list is vast, and the pizza is fab. All employees I have encountered have been great! I wish I lived closer so I could hang out there more.

QH369Mv0uvmlutJV7tbzIQ.text: After driving by time and time again on our way to the Thomas Street area, we attempted to eat at Dish (closed on Sunday?) so we ended up at Intermezzo. It was a beautiful day so we sat outside. At first the beeping from the crosswalk was annoying, then they turned on some music and it sort of drowned it out and it was not really an issue.   Food-wise, it was good. We went with the Piroska (calzone-like thing) and a spinach pizza. The Piroska was pretty good with mushrooms, ham, mozzarella and ricotto cheese. The spinach pizza was okay, we thought it was a little bland overall.   Our server was excellent and friendly.   Overall, nothing that would make me want to return right away, but it was good.

ctPS1bjTkfi6D3S88mAQEA.text: I loved this place. The atmosphere is laid-back & casual with a cool upscale feel. The bar is centrally located.  Not many tables inside, but more seating is available on the patio when weather permits.  We came here on a Saturday night last winter. Every table was full, so we sat at the bar. The pizza looked great, but we wanted to try Serbian dishes.  The bartender (owner?) was friendly and fun and helped us decide what to eat.  We started with the shopska salad. Tomatoes were not in season, and the bartender apologized for that, but the salad was dressed well and the feta cheese (sheep's milk) was delicious. Then we ordered and split the spinach burek and cabbage rolls - hearty, hot, wonderful flavors. Both were really great and the sauces were incredible. The bread was dense and crusty.  I think this is a special place and I would love to go back! It will be hard to not order that same meal all over again ...

dpm_Jzg7vyQWZUJCdSrnAw.text: My go-to for neighborhood pizza! I probably eat here at least three times a month.  Their goat cheese crostini is the BEST and their pasta is so fresh you will never be able to eat the dried stuff again.  The owners are so nice and hardworking and the food is consistently delicious.  Bonus: if you live in the area they deliver.  Highly highly recommend!

OfaLwIHQMCZYNb5nd15-mw.text: Our visit here was unplanned but I am SO glad we found it!  We stopped around lunchtime.  We had the choice to sit outside (very nice looking patio area) or inside.  We opted for inside since the pollen is AWFUL right now.  Julie waited on us.  The menu didn't have any kids items but she told me that they are happy to make kids pasta with sauce or butter or cheese (or all of the above.)  She got my daughters order in immediately so she wouldn't starve.    I had a pizza and my wife had blackened chicken pasta.  We all loved what we got.  I'm talking DELICIOUS.  And Julie was awesome and kept our drinks refilled.    Overall i would rate it as one of our favorites.

2tXbgDi4sRHsje3fGEghCA.text: I can honestly say that I think this is the first time I've had Serbian food. And I'm a fan, thanks Intermezzo!   Not only does Intermezzo have a great patio, with plenty of fans mind you, they sport a cozy interior and a really unique menu of pizzas and Serbian items I haven't indulged in before. I popped in here for a quick lunch with a friend and while I ordered the grilled vegetable sandwich, I had a severe case of food envy when I saw my friend's dish come out - the ground beef burek. It looked like a pretzel roll and a beef slider had a baby. And she was quite pleased with it too!  Onto my sandwich, two pieces of delicious crusty bread hugged wood fired squash, portabella mushrooms, asparagus, zucchini, tomatoes. The best part though? The incredible goat cheese spread that was thinly layered beneath the veggies - I would like that in a cup, please. I chose the roasted potatoes as my side - nice and toasty, with a pleasant crisp. Prices and service were both friendly and I definitely want to head back and try a myriad of their Serbian dishes. And maybe a pizza. Times two.

TOipKJuffqHVAMdRw89WbA.text: Delicious food.  I love the bruschetta and the burek.  Pizzas are perfectly cooked, yet different from what we normally think of pizza. The staff there is so friendly, the owners make a point to talk to everyone and they always have a smile on their face. We'll be going back again soon!!!!!

SsAqgKv80_fAkCSaxfOoAg.text: Many thanks to Yelp for introducing me to a restaurant I likely never would have ventured to otherwise!   The reviews for Intermezzo were great, so my expectations were high. I met 2 friends here on one of those uncharacteristically warm, still technically winter, Charlotte days, just to give you an idea of the perfection I had ingrained in my mind.   Intermezzo did NOT disappoint. It met my high standards, and then some. As I waited for my friends to arrive, I caught a whiff of, what I believe was the Garlic Braided Twist appetizer. Must try them next time. They smelled UNREAL.   We began with the antipasto plate and Portobello Mushroom Tower. They were both great! I loved the assortment of meats and cheeses, and the goat cheese on the Mushroom Tower was so creamy and just, perfect really. Next time, I will ask for a bread basket.   I ordered the Sarma (Cabbage Rolls) as my entree. With all of the amazing sounding Serbian dishes on the menu, I figured, do as the Serbians do! I may as well have licked my plate.   One friend ordered a pizza. She raved! I was too busy wolfing down Sarma and my other friend's food to get a bite. The other dish I tried was the Blackened Chicken Pasta. The menu's description doesn't sound that enticing, but I was in chili powder heaven. It was subtly spicy, smoky, creamy, rich...   Ok--remind me not to write restaurant reviews when I haven't had my lunch. GO TO INTERMEZZO!

gr88qxG9WssyMvFWpMV1pA.text: Service at this restaurant has declined. This was my go to place every-time I visited the area before making it my home. The food was so good and service so pleasant, but not anymore. Place has a funny odor now, never going back again.

w15snc08NIrL-3ck7QKkmQ.text: Ahh Intermezzo your 1/2 price martini's on Sat. Night made me so happy....I must have tried at least six  different kinds and all be back for the cantaloupe.  This restaurant is such a great find the staff is very friendly the place is small but has a great outdoor seating area when the warmer weather arrives you'll find me here.  Let's talk about food as suggested by fellow yelpers i went for the beef burek delicious the homemade phyllo dough was unbelievable.  Make sure to order some apps the corn dip and goat cheese crostini's were a big hit. I can't wait to get back and try some pizza!

yGEEtqWRhMaNu97_bht6PA.text: This is a fun little pizzeria/Serbian food restaurant that is very unassuming on the outside, yet quite charming inside.  The brick and exposed beams create a cozy, slightly rustic atmosphere.  I ordered the grilled veggie sandwich and was very impressed.  The fresh baked bread, goat cheese, and lightly grilled fresh veggies was the perfect combination for a light-ish meal.    Our server was awesome, we had everything we needed at all points during the meal.  The cost was extremely reasonable.  This place is great for a low key dinner or lunch.

DX5dvvsQp4kpsOUhtMwOAQ.text: For some reason the first time we went to Intermezzo I wasn't really impressed.  It was right when they first opened and we sat outside in the heat with lots of traffic passing by.  We didn't even wander inside.  I wish I'd known that dining inside is a completely different experience.  This time around I loved Intermezzo!  The atmosphere was very cool and cozy and had that Plaza Midwood feel.  They have cool local art work on the brick walls and they had kind of a funky music playlist that half the time included rave/techno ish music and the rest of the time was more low key alternative.  I don't know if it was just because I was starving, but I thought their pizza was amazing!  I actually ventured to say it's my new favorite pizza in Charlotte.  We had the supreme style pizza and all the veggies were so fresh and full of flavor.  Yum!  Plus they topped if off with slices of tomato which I'm not usually a big fan of but this time around I thought it was delicious.  Their menu isn't terribly extensive but it doesn't matter to me because I will always be ordering this pizza from now on.

6H4h6NE78Xr3AYmyy8geKQ.text: First look at the menu and I was impressed. Interesting and unique dishes. We ordered the stuffed peppers and a grouper special. Presentation was nice however the food was lacking in flavor. It was good but not great. I will go back... The food is good and it's unique so there are definitely more dishes to try.  Oh.. The service was great! Our server was on top of our every need!

lsbUM0jpYLwZLW0CjwY7SQ.text: My stand-by restaurant, and the one I probably frequent most in Charlotte.  Why?  The food is consistently excellent, and the service is great.  Eric, Georgie (one of the the owners) and the other lovely waiter whose name I don't know(!) always go out of their way to make everyone feel at home).  I recommend the Breakfast and Spinach Ricotta Pizzas as well as the Wood-fired Vegetable Sandwich--all are delish.  If they have any Balkan specials, those are worth trying too b/c the dudes who own this place are totally representing their motherland.    As an added plus, they always have great drink specials (e.g., half-off martinis on Saturdays) and appetizers are 50% between 5-7pm (I recommend the corn dip and portabello mushroom tower).  Their outdoor seating area is a big hit in the warmer months, too, and is a good place for groups.

6AHMRcnPkIxgl4jXkH5RPQ.text: Totally rad in my book. I went with a friend who knows the servers andthe owner. The servers being all attractive and playful, were wonderfully attentive. Our pizza "millenise" (I think that was the name) was delisious and came out fast. Hell we ate that pizza  fast. The pie had red onions, sausage and mozz that was made in house. the crust is thin enough to be crunchy but thick enough to not be called a cracker. The wine list is good and desserts were too!!!!! Had the crepes with strawberrys and a hazel-choco drizzle.   This restaurant is my friends favorite in town for atmosphere and food. Its not the most expensive place, and you might not impress a stiff, but this is the kind of place you want to take people you care about and want to enjoy yourself.

aAYT6m1vDK0XiH2Dsg5cog.text: Ate here on a lovely Sunday evening after seeing the restaurant on DDD. I had the stuffed cabbage rolls and my husband had the Piroska. Everything was awesome! We also had the crepes to share for dessert & they were phenomenal. The place is very small.. I can imagine it getting very crowded on fri or sat night. Nice outdoor seating. Only reason why I gave 4 stars is due to the price.. I felt it was a little overpriced for the size of portions you received. Will definitely return though!

3ZEnDuzPA--ud1Y99mb-sw.text: Had the margarita pizza late night and two beers, cost me almost $30 for below mediocore pizza.  The waitress did tell us it does not have sauce on it so we requested sauce instead but they left tomoatoes on there.  A truly sorry and sorry tasting pizza.  Maybe the other pizzas are good but this pizza was awful.  I have heard good things about the other food so if I try some of that i will go back and update but definitely not the pizza.

svMKeksSrZYb0HGN3t30kw.text: Went here on a Saturday evening around 11:30 and while I went with a friend, my first impression of this place was "Wow, great little romantic place for a date!". With exposed brick walls, low lighting and some rustic Italian/Baroque charm (think Milan art gallery, not Olive Garden decor). The bar was full and a few booths had people, but we didn't have to wait and got a little booth by a window looking out at the street.  Saturdays they have 1/2 priced martinis so I indulged and got a Honeydew martini as well as a Berry martini and both were amazing. The Berry had over 6 liqueurs in it, so needless to say I was a happy camper only having to pay $4.50 for it!  My friend ordered the Fungi pizza and it was great - the crust wasn't thin like a cracker but was just thick enough to give a great wood grilled taste and allow the fresh ingredients to really speak for themselves. I had the Intermezzo salad (balsamic dressing came on top and it was a BIT oily for my taste) and the veggie lasagna. The lasagna was a spot on choice. I dare say it's the best I've ever had with wood grilled vegetables, an aromatic array of spices, a nice chunky but light marinara and fresh Parmesan on top. Our meal also came out with homemade bread cut into 4 pieces which was just icing on the cake - the bread was just hands down impressive and really a memorable addition to the meal (how often do you get to say that about bread??!?!).  Our server was Trey and he was a great balance between attentive and relaxed, and was so warm it definitely made a great impression on us - we left saying "Can't wait to go back!".  Excited to try some of their Eastern European dishes next time....

f9V7LqSxKaJ1KUufoGhPsA.text: Intermezzo is one of those gems that didn't catch my eye from the road but word of mouth about their delicious food caught my ear!  My short reasoning for giving Intermezzo 5 stars - a) food is amazing, b) price can't be beat.  My only desire for this restaurant is to update the decor inside, and dust the wine racks.  Other than that, I had no complaints.  I went with some friends around 6:30 on a Friday.  We were pleasantly surprised to get a table immediately (only 2 left inside).  The menu made my mouth water.  The selection of appetizers, pizzas and entrees sent me into sensory overload!  Since we were all so undecided, we decided to share.  I was able to sample the Mediterranean Salad, the Grilled Eggplant and the Sauteed Spinach Pizza.  The Grilled Eggplant absolutely surpassed my expectations.  It was perfectly dressed in a basil olive oil, ripe sweet tomatoes, and a dash of balsamic - I could have eaten the whole plate.  Similarly, the pizza swept me off my feet.  I'm from NY, so it's hard to find pizza that can do that!  The dough is fresh, and allows me to fold my pizza (sign of a True NY'er).  All of the ingredients blended together wonderfully.  Last on my food list was the salad.  There was a mix of baby greens, feta, black olives, and we substituted the sun-dried tomato dressing for a balsamic dressing.  It was light and a perfect fit to our meal.  The added bonus to the food menu is the martini menu.  Holy freaking cow.  There must have been 20 different choices.  I opted for the Cantaloupe - a refreshing choice it was!  As most martini prices go, they ranged from $9 to $11.  However, there are much cheaper drink options.  My friends opted for the draft beer specials - $3 Stella's!  We will definitely be dining in again or taking advantage of their delivery very soon!

mE9NjnduUd4wDsU8frNnRg.text: Great place with incredible food and service!  Ian was our waiter tonight and he was great, and patient with our kids. The corn dip is wonderful and different - warm, cheesy and creamy, and clearly filled with fresh veggies! My 4 year old are an entire 10 inch pizza!!  My husband and I shared the stuffed cabbage...better than his Polish mother's...and the ground beef Burek. It was all amazing and we will definitely be back.

iUGQVOoWo6nK7RehYoo3hg.text: This place kills it on Groupon! Always a 1000+ bought! The food and the people are great; I love the blackened chicken pasta and always end it with the strawberry and chocolate crepe! The at atmosphere is semi-intimate depending on where you sit. Definitely check it out if you haven't been.

CCR1SLKj83EC00r2ZDwDjQ.text: I ate here last week with a friend using a Groupon. The food was already surprisingly affordable, but I really impressed with how fresh and flavorful the appetizers and entrees were (had garlic twists, chicken francese, and portabella mushroom tower) given the price of the food. The server was fantastic, and the atmosphere of the place was pretty mellow, in line with the whole Plaza Midwood area. Definitely will be back again. Check it out!

Rp7ljgg6rR6b7I2k5ETUFA.text: Went for dinner and it was slammed. Staff seemed to be overwhelmed. Turned out they had just released a Groupon and everyone in town had cashed in on it. Despite a wait, Adam was a super nice server and took care of us.  App: Portabello Mushroom Tower - wouldn't call this a tower, more like a small speedbump but it was good, goat cheese was delicious  Entree: Vege Lasagna - great, really like the sauce  Entree: Wood Grilled Vegetable Sandwich - dining companion had this and she raved about it  Also liked the small, cozy bricked interior - good stuff.

EB9lRTaU_Mm13aQ9eEw9RQ.text: Intermezzo was a fantastic experience from beginning to end. Service is seriously top notch. They take their presentation extremely seriously. Came here for a date night and it was the perfect environment. Ordered shrimp pasta and my girlfriend ordered blackened chicken pasta. Portion sizes were absolutely perfect and quality was exceptional. Also ordered the crostini with red sauce as an appetizer. Everything was delicious. Dont forget to order homemade bread.

BtYkMUY6J6wKdwQG4ri0RQ.text: Loved my Florentine Spinach pizza & was especially happy to find this place after being underwhelmed by other Plaza Midwood pizza restaurants.  I moved here from Chicago and had almost given up.  Loved the interior dining room with bar.  Cozy especially on a rainy day.  I'll be back.

ymUmAVU8OCFZi3BmDlOkOQ.text: Intermezzo has always been a go to place for me and my girlfriends. Atmosphere is great and the drinks are good. Tonight was beyond disappointing. I ordered the shopska salad and I have to say, it was the worst salad I've ever had.  For 8.75 I got the most mealy tomatoes and a saucer sized serving that would barely qualify as an appetizer. A True chef would never serve those tomatoes. I blame myself for ordering something with tomatoes when they are not in season. But the size of the serving is on them. I give it 2stars for the service and atmosphere. Next time I will suggest we try somewhere new. There are too many places in the same area that are competing for our business.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

nIMxE-azxbilEarDKUYArg.text: A hard to navigate corner heading into Plaza Midwood, but once you get there, there's delicious pizza and Serbian food waiting for you. Their plates are huge and you'll definitely have leftovers to take home.   This trip, we came on a Saturday night. My husband got a large pizza and I got the Breca something (it was breaded pork cutlet). My husbands pizza was full of veggies and meat on every slice and he couldn't have been happier. My meal was extremely dry, and I asked for olive oil to help. Our (wonderful) server said that the Serbs eat this meal with the creamed spinach on top of the pork. I wish it would have been served that way, or I was told how to eat it when it came to the table because I couldn't get past the dryness, but the spinach did help!   This is definitely a spot to check out and expand your pallet on (or stay in the safe zone with their traditional fare)!

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. The side of spinach that should have been on my pork.
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. The breaded pork cutlet (brecka sonething) and potatoes.
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. The large pizza.

pyX2VgICAGIh803QZufT8w.text: How much longer till they go out of business?  Could they be more expensive? 4 large pizzas and 2 beers is $116?!?!??! I dont care how good it is, that is absurd. $7 pints? In Chatlotte?  What the hell? Sorry, Intermezzo, I'm done.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

6nEB9ygVRRcbpXApe9t77w.text: Pizza plus old world Serbian fare? That equation may sound odd, but it feels so right. And delicious.   I think I've had almost everything on the menu. It's all pretty good. Their pizza is some of my favorite in Charlotte. I like both the Capriccioso and Intermezzo Supreme. App wise, the bruschetta is great. I love how the housemade Mozzarella is melted over the tomatoes. Portabella mushroom tower is yummy as well, just note that it's a smaller size starter. The shopska is a good salad-like option to share. The eggplant musaka and cabbage rolls are delicious. I think the Piroska is a hidden star on this menu. It's kind of like stuffed pizza or calzone type dish. I always add spinach to mine.   You can order online via their website for pick up or delivery. They do half priced wine on Wednesdays. The patio has a nice view of the skyline. Gah, our city is so pretty.   I've known Branko and Djordje since back in their days of working at Cosmos a decade ago. They are hard workers, take a lot of pride in what they do, and are just great people in general. So proud of them and all they are doing at Intermezzo.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Intermezzo Supreme
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sarma (cabbage Rolls)
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Portabella Mushroom Tower

GbS6TnZeItFfvG3nZssnnA.text: I tried this restaurant for the first time a few nights ago with a friend and was not impressed.  The bartender greeted us and a waitress unenthusiastically mumbled that we could sit anywhere.  We told our server that we had never been before and since there seemed to be a lot of delicious options on the menu, we asked her for a couple of recommendations. The waitress was extremely short with us and acted like we were a burden even though we seemed to be her only table.  We ordered an appetizer and our server asked us if we wanted marinara sauce. We said yes and when we got our bill, we discovered that we had been charged $2 for about two tablespoons of marinara. I know $2 is not a lot of money, but my friend and I likely would have turned down the marinara if we had been informed that it would cost extra.  I ordered the "House Made Ravioli" for $16.95. My plate came out with five lukewarm ravioli and way too much tomato cream sauce.  I doubt I'll return to this place.

xHWxT4TenyD9tqCtajB3jw.text: I have nothing but good things to say about Intermezzo, except that I wish they were closer to my house! Everything we've tried there has been great - I especially love the beef burek and the highly addictive corn dip (Is that even Serbian? Not sure).   Last visit we lucked out and found out they have half priced martinis on Saturday...they were not skimping on the booze in them either. You really can't beat a $5-6 martini on the weekend. They also had half priced apps until 7, this may only be at the bar though.   Definitely a fan of Intermezzo and I need to make a point to go more often!

t7bLMQBwClQQK4KnV25vug.text: Straight up some of the best pizza I've ever had. Wife and I got the Chicken Pesto Pizza and were not disappointed! There were also half off appetizers before 7pm and some really great $3 beer specials. Great service and atmosphere! We will definitely be coming back!!!!

QRU7fhDAN02v8sYxFMRZNw.text: I was very, very impressed by the service and the pizza was great!! Delicious crust that was soft yet crunchy and the ingredients were definitely fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

kmbyLLYzjPMeAQSRMUZqYA.text: We were sat quickly on a Friday night. Our server was very nice and attentive. We ordered an intermezzo salad to split, the 16 inch intermezzo supreme pizza. As someone from up north it's hard to find good pizza in Charlotte. This was good pizza. I will definitely be returning to Intermezzo.

kSrFTk9P6E06_FvyPTuVdg.text: This place is truly a gem to Charlotte! I'm so glad I finally got a chance to give them a try.  We started with two appetizers the Ricotta and Goat Cheese Crostini and Bruschetta. They were both excellent. I especially loved the homemade sauce that comes with the crostini. So yummy and great for dipping!   I'd recommend both of them if it's your first time!   For my meal I ordered the Piroska. Geesh, it was amazing! I absolutely agree with Nikki - this is definitely a hidden star on the menu! I mean it's similar to a calzone and packed with flavor. Based on a recommendation from our server I added spinach and it was a perfect combination of awesome. I also got to sample a bit of the eggplant moussaka and it's just as yummy!   I mean there are a ton of great options here! I seriously do not think you can go wrong. There's so much more that I want to try so I'm already looking forward to coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Piroska
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bruschetta
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crostini

AICUFIsbM9WaROXGxVGk_A.text: Everything was very tasty. Nice to try something different!  The atmosphere is laid back. Huge patio for outside dining. Bar was quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Everything was very tasty. Nice to try something different!

n9On2-5KqEomcPvQecIZIg.text: Ordered delivery from here the other night for the first time and was pretty happy with our experience. Delivery was relatively quick for a Friday night, food was hot when it arrived and all was pretty tasty!  We got a supreme pizza, grilled steak sandwich, and lasagna which we were pretty happy with. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the portions aren't huge, hence the 3 main items for 2 people. We crushed it all thoug and this may become a regular order for us!

qgGV0nfVdysuunxdWr3RAw.text: So I called at 5 pm. on a Monday to see if the flour they use is a pure, unadulterated or not "enriched."  *I've got dietary reasons for avoiding such flour.      I knew it would be a high-gluten flour, and that was all she could tell me, but she sounded so annoyed by my phone call and question. I offered to leave my name and number and said it would be fine if they shot me a quick text message to let me know the answer. I guess I shouldn't be surprised they didn't get back to me?  Their pizza might be awesome, but I'm not going to know if they can't answer a simple question about the flour in their dough.

3MgfolUNO0PiZ4soB7VgoQ.text: Was excited to have a couple of cocktails before a show at Ovens, and wasn't impressed with their cocktails or martinis. Next time I'll stick with a beer.

zzc2FNxOHZty7D5LsRr0Rw.text: Got here. There is private parking which is nice. It's in a cool part of the city. It's a very small inside part of the restaurant but there's a very large patio. Upon arrival at 7:40pm (on a Sunday) we had to wait for about 15 minutes and then were promptly seated. We got water. I drank my water and then waited for awhile until my server brought more. And then the pizza came out. It was phenomenal. My wife and I got 2 10-inch pizzas for under $30. It was amazing!

12YsEuopH-7WHr4lbnHfQw.text: We had an awesome dinner experience here. We came in on a weekday around 8 pm. We were greeted by a host and immediately seated. Our waiter, Trey, approached our table quickly and made great drink recommendations. I was going to start with a Blue Moon, but he recommended some beer (something of Brussels, I think). It was awesome!   For dinner, we started by sharing some of their homemade bread. It was warm, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. For entrees, we both resisted our urge to go with something tradition and instead opted for some of their Serbian dishes. I had the piroska and added spinach and onions. I was hesitant about the sour cream but it was delicious. My boyfriend had the karadjordjeva and he loved it! He described it as similar to chicken cordon bleu. I had hoped to have room for a Nutella crepe but was far too full.   Great food. Great drinks. Great service.  We will definitely be back.

Xsx__9zPfR1UKQ_gtEb4rQ.text: After months I finally made it to Intermezzo. I decided to try a variety of items, to get a good idea of their food. I started with a house salad. House salad is lettuce, carrots, cucumber and onion with a balsamic dressing. The salad was good, but nothing great.  After the salad I had the bruschetta and chicken and vegetable soup. The bruschetta was amazing, toasted homemade bread with tomatoes and cheese. I did ask for a side of marinara for dipping and that made it amazing! As for the soup, chicken and veggies, carrots, zucchini, onion and corn, served in a light broth. Very nice and served perfectly warm. Service was on point and I found the environment very friendly and welcoming. Definitely will be back!

PhsMLMyJjaA28yZAOfVf4Q.text: So we drive by this place all the time but had not tried it until recently and I wish we hadn't waited so long! They have a great happy hour with half price apps and they have a solid selection of local beers. They have the best eggplant we have ever had in a restaurant it is a nice thick cut that has not been breaded and deep fried like most places! Amazing you must try it:) everyone we were with loved their meals and we sat out side and enjoyed the view of uptown.

EWD7RdqHucCU_270Sadq3A.text: Date night at Intermezzo!  Our hostess did not ask us if we preferred indoor or outdoor seating.  She proceeded to seat us at a table off to the side, which had hard card table style chairs.  The table itself was on a slope, and I felt like I was at the top of the hill and my husband was at the bottom.  We asked to be moved and were accommodated by the hostess, who appeared to be harried. Our new table sported chairs that were more comfortable. We ordered the Quattro fromagio pizza.  It appeared to be dry and over cooked, with some of the crust darkened, however, it was edible.  But, hey, it was date night!  We still had a good time!

r9suSl1hu-PLaqhyuOn57A.text: This is a go-to place for my husband and me, when we just want a casual but intimate dinner. Perfect "comfort spot"! We usually just get pizza - the crust is just perfect, nicely thin but with a lovely "crusty" crust. We love the "pepe ed olive" pizza that comes with ground beef. In fact, the ground beef (which first sounded a little odd to me) is so good, we often opt to substitute it for other meats. Ask for Parmesan; it's not just a green tub of dusty cheese, but a bowl of nicely grated actual cheese (how crazy)!   They have a relatively small but respectable selection of beers and wines. Great when you want an easy dinner, not too many choices! It's a nice, cozy setting with brick walls, just the right lighting, and really friendly servers. We often get caught up in conversations with our servers, and although they don't mind stopping to chat, you're never left waiting on them.

uuzANmtpUXRB25uCQtf_ew.text: Yum Yum. Everything we had was excellent!    Stuffed cabbage was soo good.   We had a stuffed thing with mushrooms,ham, goat cheese, that was yummy.   Also some stuffed thing with goat cheese and spinach.  Yum.   To end our meal we had tiramisu. One if my favorite desserts.  It was one of the best I've had.  Atmosphere was fun and and service was good. Although slightly pricey We will be back!!

ogPNxc14bvl_Ssh8_CHQSQ.text: Seriously a great place. The interior is really inviting and cozy. We sat 'upstairs' out of the noise and really enjoyed it.   The pomodora diversi is a must order. The veggie lasagna had an intoxicating aroma. The server was very knowledgeable about the menu and drink list. There are some really great beers to be had at good prices. I'll be back to to try the most mentioned burek!

ds-TidFF4_vSTxZturdchg.text: There Chicken Francese is an explosion of flavor, very delicious. Very great place to spend with a +1.

zru_MI5NPOjYp03odCf3Tw.text: Cozy place with old brick charm that manages to successfully bridge the 602km, two countries (Slovenia and Croatia), and the Adriatic Sea  to offer both traditional Serbian and Italian fare. Somehow, this formula works!  Came here on a late fall Friday night around 6:00pm and was able to get seated immediately, though things soon changed. By 7:00 there were people waiting in line to sit outside, though the enclosed (and actually acceptably warm) patio had plenty of space. The takeaway: arrive early, this place fills up!  Inside, the tables are spacious, not too crowded, and a good place to relax! Service was stellar and happy to help us take advantage of the $3 draft Stella or Fat Tire beer specials. Well played!  We ordered the much acclaimed Ground Beef Burek and the Wood Grilled Vegetable Sandwich. As fate would have it, right after ordering the table next to us began wafting a buttery-garlic aroma that resulted in 8.0 rumble in my tummy. We had to call back the waitress for an order of the garlic bread sticks. Yum.  Food was all-around delicious. The Burek is simply amazing: fillo dough encasing beef and onions. While the description made me think of flaky fillo dough like on Greek spanikopida, it is actually more on the doughy side (in a very positive way!). Definitely worth it and I would )and plan to) come back for the express purpose of getting this again.  I had a few bites of the Vegetable Sandwich and it was a very well put together mix of veggies and cheese. The garlic bread sticks were good, but I was expecting more based on the smell--probably worth getting once.  I shall return to sample more Serbian food!

yZ16Vcw36NpgAWPGU6C5kA.text: Some of the best food at reasonable prices. Took my father here and it was his favorite restaurant I took him too that weekend. Our favorites were the Portobella Tower appetizer and the Karadjordjeva meal.   Didn't look like much from the outside. But great home cooked, family owned restaurant with great service. Highly reccommend.

cUuu9hsq1ki10s9UypPF9A.text: IMHO the cuisine rates 3 stars at best.   I'd award it another star for the excellent service, reasonable prices, the cozily grungy dining room and good vibes ...  but I just can't do it because it's already received too many 5 stars for a restaurant that still has plenty of room for improvement  Those red curtains outside give the wrong impression, walking into the restaurant for the first time was a pleasant surprise. The waiter/bartender was super. He was friendly, always on top of things and struck the right balance between casual and respectful. Also for once I was not driving so I finally got to enjoy a Martini fueled dinner (plain with olives for me).   The Portobello tower was misnamed - it was about 2" tall. No biggie in itself, that was source of amusement really. The mushroom was a bit tough, the red peppers were great but the goat cheese was that generic (cheap) kind that every restaurant uses and almost tasteless as always. If real goat cheese is not in the budget I'd rather have some feta or even blue cheese but something with a little bite to it. At $9 I can only rate it OK, not bad.  2 1/2*  I confess that I came especially for the Spinach and Cheese Burek. I'm familiar with the Greek, Turkish and my mother's Romanian version but not the Serbian. I should have read David A's review, he did warn about the Phyllo leaves. :-[ Yes I expected crispy and flaky layers of Phyllo with sharp cheese and fresh spinach. It's been my favorite dish since childhood. Instead I was served a large artistically shaped portion of ....dough. It looked a bit like hallah but tasted like a calzone variant. The cheese was not Casieri, Cascaval or anything of the sort, probably ricotta and it was totally bland. There was not enough spinach in it to notice. I didn't expect a calzone.   Very possibly this is exactly what the Serbian version should be like I have no way of knowing it. Simply rating it on how tasty it was, I'd say 2 1/2 stars, but the salad that came with it was very good so together I'd rate the plate 3 stars.   The Moussaka was not the traditional kind either but it was excellent, it was served with a very good tomato sauce -while the Lasagna gets the bechamel, go figure. Wish it had been served with a little something on the side but the menu doesn't offer any. Still I'd rate their  Moussaka 4 stars.    Dessert was crepes stuffed with a big mound of fruits. It kind of looked like crepes but it tasted like, and had the consistency of, American pancake - only thinner.  The pricing is generally moderate but inconsistent. Main dishes are only $11-13 but appetizers like humus ($9.25) corn dip w/tortillas ($9) or the Portobello I mentioned are way overpriced for this venue. Plus they don't offer any side dishes, IMO the menu needs a little tweaking and I'm offering this as constructive criticism.  All together it made for an enjoyable dinner and I'm looking forward to going back and trying other dishes. I'm thinking of the pork schnitzel and the stuffed cabbage  next time.

kuCSVlKp8M_g1sebAwUlyg.text: Whenever we want pizza, this is the place we call (for delivery). We've eaten here several times and thought it's worth mentioning. They also have pretty good hummus and other options for those who don't want Italian. I have no complaints and this is where we go for Italian. However, it doesn't blow my socks off. I've eaten at Italian restaurants (when living in Charleston, SC) that are out of this world. This place is good, and that's about it. Nothing outstanding here.

cPGwQNz3yYHVVZc72zHTZQ.text: Only have been to this place twice but both times have been wonderful!  I had been told by several friends that I needed to try it!  The atmosphere is upbeat and energetic and so are the staff.  Very friendly and helpful.  Both times we have gotten the same thing, the spinach pizza.  It is delicious!  The leftovers never make it to the next day!  If there are any!!!  Ready to head back and try some other dishes.

gsIJF0nBL7SUvyh4Pyy10g.text: Trey, our server had us as soon as he said:   "We're just a small locally owned restaurant with a Mama and two boys. We don't have a freezer or a deep fryer, we make everything, including our mozzarella in house".   How could I NOT love this place!  It's got a cozy interior, most everything is made in-house, and our server was super helpful in recommending dishes and telling us about how each is made. Just don't whiz by and miss this place, because it's easy to do, despite it's prominent position smack dab in the intersection of some busy streets.   To the food!  Appetizer, Ricotta/Goat Cheese Crostini: Super fresh tasting ricotta and goat cheeses, melted and toasted on a pizza crust like bread, light and airy and super crisp. Delish!  Margarita Pizza: Just how I like it.  Fresh home made mozz, big slices of tomato, plenty of basil and the crust in a crunchy, chewy, olive oil brushed crust.  Super fresh.   The creme de la creme...the jewel of our meal...the warm-your-insides-on-a-brisk-fall-day...the stuffed cabbage. We were told the cabbage is pickled in a barrel for a month, then stuffed with bacon, ground beef and other ingredients, and cooked for 4 hours until it's delightfully tender and flavorful.  The two stuffed cabbages come in a super savory, salty broth you sop up with either the homemade bread, or...what we did, our pizza crusts.   The strawberry, banana and hazelnut chocolate crepe was recommended to us, and perfectly eggy, lacy and brown on the edges...with a nice cup of tea it was the perfect ending to our meal.   Intermezzo is definitely my latest restaurant obsession!  TIP: Mama loves Tennis and Djokovic so the Tennis Channel was on both the TVs we saw. Our good service, delicious food and stories behind the restaurant made me want to write Djokovic's agent, and ask if he could send Mama an autographed photo.

-ATrYw4Xt3mpkYYzMa59yg.text: The ultimate neighborhood bar / restaurant!  Absolutely love this place!  AMBIENCE:   Inside is cozy and warm with exposed brick walls, wood beam ceiling and the sweet smell of the wood fire grill cooking.    Outside patio is specious and cool.    SERVICE:   Friendly. Attentive. Knowledgeable about food and their menu.   FOOD:   Everything tastes good! Great selection.  Eclectic menu. Full of flavor.  There Pizzas are thin crust with FRESH toppings and True italian seasonings.  My favorite is the Grilled Vegetable Sandwich - it's so tasty!  Made with home-made bread, some goat cheese then filed with fresh vegetables grilled in the wood burning grill.  The Serbian food is yummy, too.  Authentic European style!  Satisfies my craving for wienerschnitzle and other delectable treats.  The brushetta is my favorite appetizer - perfectly crusted bread with fresh tomatoes and tons of fresh basil then melted fresh mozzarella on top.  I could keep writing but it's making me so hungry :-)  DRINK:   Good pour for a good price!  Always fun to hang at the bar, good service and good selection of liquors.  They have an awesome happy hour drink special on Thursdays ... only $3 for Stoli flavors.    SUMMARY: We passed this place a thousand times before we finally stopped and gave it a try.  - now we go every week!  It is TRULY worth trying out if you haven't been.

hhaHv-yge9-o8hBldupzlA.text: Ordered takeout last night from Intermezzo... The stuffed peppers and red roasted pepper bruschetta are just two of my favorites! I now have a top favorite to add to my "lazy night ordering". What a great meal to end the long work week!

FTG9uDa2SaWHqyE8wqY50Q.text: I guess I am in the minority here. This place is just so so to me. It is a pizzeria/Serbian restaurant. We happened to be in the area and decided to try it. The pizza was average to me. We had a ricotta & goat cheese appetizer which was good. Perhaps the Serbian dishes are better. I also thought the service was lacking. The server didn't explain the menu well, was inattentive and slow to refill  soft drinks & water and forgot to brink another drink ordered.  If I was in this area again, I might stop here to try a Serbian dish, but I would not return for the pizza.

ZANyQvzlP_NBBK7CuzXdOQ.text: I am a pizza snob, so I might be over-critical. The place definitely rocks, and it's not that difficult to get to with parking or traffic.   I can recommend the Margherita pizza, Spinach supreme, and Grilled Veggie pizza. It's good pizza, and even if you have insane pizza standards like me, you won't leave feeling disappointed.   The bruschetta is just okay. The garlic braided twists are surprisingly good.   Pretty cool atmosphere, but do yourself a favor and sit outside. It's just a better experience, even if the weather is a bit poor.   Yes, there are televisions outside in case you want to watch sports. Beer selection could be better.   Service is fine.

7ivw6poHwiHK_u1mHBx5Zw.text: Serbian's make incredible pizza. Who knew? When we pulled up, I'm not gonna lie... I was expecting to walk in and see one table with a bunch of butch, serbian guys sitting around plotting the rebirth of the empire. Forgive me for the stereotype, I was incredibly wrong. They were just watching soccer.  The restaurant isn't in the hippest of Charlotte areas, but the food was incredible. Up there with some of the best pizza I have ever had the pleasure of putting in my mouth. The interior was also nicely set up with a cozy, non-motherland feel to it. We had the chicken florentine pizza with roasted red pepper bruschetta. I want to go back, right. now.  It was Superbowl Sunday, but at lunch. The place was pretty busy and they only had one server, but she handled herself very well and took care of everyone. If we do make it back there, I definitely want to try the more traditional Serbian entres. They looked tasty as well.

Dbm7Z40X_LFEPz6mSCYVmw.text: I like Intermezzo a lot.  The 1st time I came here a few years ago I ordered the wrong thing and kind of wrote it off, but gave it another shot last summer and am so glad I did!  The pizzas are really good here.  Nice and thin, with a good chewy crust.  I love the corn dip appetizer.  Its whole corn kernels and some cheese and other deliciousness.  The bolognese is extremely yummy.  Nice and hearty with the homemade pasta, perfect comfort food.  I could go on, but you get the point, everything is really good.  I have always had good service here, so no complaints there.  Prices are reasonable, the patio is nice, and its not too far from home.  What's not to love!!

0e8agDHU8-9tu4C5-Q9qXg.text: Great food and great service. Try the goat cheese and ricotta appetizer. Also love the Intermezzo pizza. All the food here is great and love the patio when the weather is pleasant!  Great selection of beer. Also wine special during the week!

vmiwm3KNV-jszB3J7snXyQ.text: My favorite place in Charlotte! 'Nuff said.  The Burrek is yummy and goes well with a glass of Blanche De Brussels beer.

oJ7VxRwucKVW4G0lCnemZQ.text: Made my first trip here this past week after I've heard and read such good things about this place, so of course I had to check it out: . . Pictured: -Ricotta and Goat cheese crostini (not a goat cheese fan myself) but the flavor of the ricotta mixed was excellent.  -Mexican Pizza (seasoned beef, mozzarella, black beans, tomatoes, scallions, cilantro, jalapenos, and spicy cream) HOLY COW! This was one of the best pizzas I've had in Charlotte, the waiter told us it was good but I was blow away. Great taste and flavors.  . . If your Looking for a wonderful place to check out, this is it. Perfect for family dinner or a night out with friends.

sbpJcwbIW3oXTNn7c-y06A.text: Intermezzos is a great restaurant. This was my first time here and I'm sure it's not going to be my last. Location is in a trendy area of Charlotte and they have onsite parking. The service was great, we were seated quickly, my server was very knowledgeable and had great recommendations, and out food came out quickly. They also have a covered patio are if you want to eat outside and not get beaten down by the hot sun.   Now the menu is a cross between Serbian and Italian. It threw me off for a little bit but as long as you give it a chance you won't be disappointed. I ordered the chicken francese normally the dish comes with mashed potatoes but I subbed it for noodles and it came out very very good. Great lemon flavor and not too over powering.   I would totally recommend this place to anyone. I also hear they have great Pizza. I'll have to try for the next time I come.

BbcKZ8svyY_yGiuq0IOsdg.text: Absolutely amazing. I'm still in here and leaving a review. This food is boooommmmbbbbb. I had te chicken and vegetable Alfredo and my boy had the stuffed bell peppers . We slammed.   Delicious. Great service. Fast and absolutely amazing.  I'm coming back at minimum once a month from here on out.

jZV6lExjM65BXIRLT_R8lA.text: Have lived in Plaza Midwood for a while now and finally got around to checking this place out. Appetizers were half price (I think a happy hour special- went on a Wednesday at 6pm). Started off with the Ricotta And Goat Cheese Crostini with a side of marinara as recommended by the waiter. Very tasty and the ricotta evened out the goat cheese flavor a lot. Then my boyfriend and I split the 16 inch Mexican Pizza which was very tasty! The crema on it was great. Perfect portion for two people. Cool space with a nice outside patio right at the 5 way intersection in plaza. Only wish here would be for there to be a few more apps to choose from. Great experience and will definitely be back!

dEDPuq9AEdPKahChVxxoaQ.text: Intermezzo is one of our favorite pizza places in the plaza midwood area! Excellent staff and good food. Their pizza is amazing. We haven't yet branched our to the Serbian side of the Ned I, but have every intention of doing so soon. Good prices make it overall a good value!

HqqbBe2SUf0Ned_M_d5a6Q.text: I've lived in Charlotte for close to three years and recently decided to branch out of my normal "pizza zone" to try Intermezzo. I'm glad I branched out!  The hubby and I got here around 6:15 PM on a Saturday night and there was NO wait - yes please. We sat outside because at the time it was still warm out in Charlotte, and slightly regret that decision due to the influx of flies that bombarded us as soon as our pizza was served... but I guess that's part of the risk, right? Our server was friendly and attentive which balanced out the annoying bug issue.  We started off with the Garlic Braided Twists with marinara sauce for dipping and were thrilled when our server told us we made it in time for half-off apps. We ordered the Intermezzo Supreme (no olives) and were quite happy with our choice.   Next time we're here, I'd like to try one of the non-pizza options -- everything looks and sounds delicious. Looking forward to it!

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic braided twists

JOAw0vokKZ7WzGwqwjCS0w.text: A must to check out!!!  Fresh ingredients and a punch of flavor!  We have been here a few times now. The first time we came here as a group if four. We ordered the Bruschetta app that was very tasty and had fresh tomatoes and delicious mozzarella cheese (we ate it before I could snap a picture). We have tried the eggplant musaka - it is surprising in how great the flavors are in this dish!!, lasagna - a Italian favorite that does not disappoint as it taste like everything came straight out of a garden so full of flavor and freshness, chicken and veggie pasta - a generous amount of pasta and veggies smothered in a light flavorful sauce.  We are back for more! This time we got the corn dip as an app - heat from the jalapenos perfectly complements the corn and cheese. We ordered the lasagna and eggplant musaka for this evening. Just as delicious as the first time we came here!!    This place continues to amaze me! Always delicious and flavorful. I will keep coming back for sure!!

-ZnSp8yGCy-9YW-ACZOBlg.text: Service is fabulous and full of some of the best old school awesome servers you will ever encounter in Charlotte... they'll have a full restaurant plus the bar and still take wonderful care of you.   And then there's the food; some of the most wonderful collaborations of Serbian comfort food you will ever have. This place has amazing pasta dishes, great pizza, and amazing sauce. Yes, pay the $2 up charge for extra sauce... you won't regret it.   Crepes are also delicious and they always have a great drink special. Side note, they never close for inclement weather and it's dark enough to grub that hangover away.

nsyj-BYvbqNzbCH8sXVHmg.text: Great food, great atmosphere and great service! I stopped in here after reading some reviews. I  travel the whole country and try to go to local places whenever I can. This restaurant doesn't disappoint. All of the servers and bartenders have been great. One of the owners, George introduced himself as well. He's a naturalized citizen living the dream.  Don't pass this place up! Family atmosphere and killer food, great beers!

rdCG2vzfuHxYS0vJELlCbA.text: The pizza were great. The best so far i had in charlotte. However, service was really bad. The server we had made us feel we are having food for free. If asked what drink you would recommend , answer was i don't drink. We had to go to bartender who was kind and served us good drinks.  So if you don't care for service ... give it a shot.

-iOo_HyA7DnSP0u72jB4RQ.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. Showed up at 10:45pm intending to eat some Serbian food. Saw that Intermezzo was open till Midnight and went out of my way to eat some Cevapi or Burek. After getting seated the waitress informed me that the oven was just turned off. And??? You cannot turn it back on? What the hell....

aKmSSy7YM9ETGHwsfjoR5w.text: Holy crap- I don't ever do reviews - ever.   But this place is good. Keep in mind it's a Serbian restaurant that sells American food.  Try the Cajun shrimp and the Sarma. Amazing.  This was really great, authentic tasting Serbian food.

YXrOV_d1QGEVY5lfyMILFA.text: Not my piece of pizza.  I had some company at my place and we had craving for pizza. Since I'm still not familiar with charlotte yet, it was suggested we try Intermezzo Pizzeria.  We ordered two large pizzas, the Wood Grilled Fungi and the Chicken Florentine. Personally, I wasn't satisfied. I prefer my pizza, to be real Italian style with a twist of risen and light crust- just a personal preference!  On another note, here are some facts about Intermezzo: - It has been serving Charlotte for 10 years.  - Handmade dough and mozzarella.  - Hand-tossed pizza - Traditional Serbian dishes - They deliver to Uptown, Elizabeth, and the Plaza-Midwood areas!  Three Yelps.

9dDhMNqYADmJ7qqSTKJlow.text: I used to love Intermezzo until last night. I made a reservation earlier in the week for 12. It was my husbands birthday. They put us on the patio. It took 30 minutes to receive the drinks we ordered. Almost 50 minutes for apps and over an hour to get our entrees. I understand that may have been busy and possibly a little understaffed. We watched other tables around us be sat and leave well before we did.  I worked in the food and beverage industry for years. If there is one little thing wrong at my table or there's long ticket times, I get management to go over and check in.  And I get them a free dessert.  I want my guests to know I care about them.  Especially if it's a special occasion like it was last night.  It's not that hard to make people feel valued.  Needless to say we did not feel valued after choosing this restaurant for our dinner. If someone makes a reservation for a special occasion, I'd suggest making sure they are taking care of.

XZW9GiI3ZIQ2jzDMM0uyjw.text: Amazing, what can I say. Walked in but did not have high expectations as most European places fail at execution of authentic food. This place was delicious. I was really pleased with the authentic Karadjordjeva and the European style pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

diD-sgKZ4qChw7aQOr3dUg.text: The food was ok, but service not so good. Middle age lady served us on the patio and she had the worse attitude! Tonight we had service with a frown!

ofFFB-j8-XVbHhY7EvdBAw.text: Pizza has always been there for me as a staple in life. Ever since I was a wee little bambina, my relationship with pizza has withstood the test of time. This was my first time experiencing this pizzeria and it was very warm and friendly. I got the sense it was a family owned and run business. We tried the corn dip appetizer which seems weird for an Italian place but it was top notch. We also got the Capricioso & Chicken Florentine half and half pizza. When I asked for ranch my server said absolutely not, we don't carry that...but I do have a homemade feta dressing. It was WAY better then ranch, just like my server said. We had some local craft beers & called it a night. Great atmosphere and would love to go back on a warm summer day to actually be able to enjoy the patio!
