dfzOKe44xu6hTQZ8DBpfjQ.text: Just dropped in to find a quick last minute meal after a long drive into town. WOW we're we surprised. Comfortable, immaculate ambiance, friendly witty service and the most delicious pizza I've eaten in a long time.   I don't think you'll be disappointed with a thin crust cooked to perfection. Nice job Intermezzo pizzeria!   Next visit to Charlotte, you'll be on my must do list!

NN3VtsDV7pGxQYEhwUuc5Q.text: Intermezzo is one of my go-to spots in Charlotte. The eggplant musaka, Mexican pizza (no joke), stuffed peppers and chicken vegetable soup are some of my favorites. Ask for Trey!

vtMXAlMYExAkcQZdPMkE4w.text: Ok...how do I even start this review? Maybe with a simple list: Atmosphere? Cute, clean, fun:) Cocktails? Done right! Food? Fresh ingredient, amazing flavors, inventive dishes and classic goodness! Service? One word- Trey!!! The most amazing server ever! He loves his job; cares about your experience; and it is like coming over to a friends for a bite to eat, when you see him!  So, overall- excellent experience! A great spot for sure! Definitely coming back, again and again!!

FSEMAdqfi8VaeqFNvRmSOw.text: The best pizza I've had in Charlotte. It may not be saying much, but it is what it is. We had the grilled veggie pizza and the Milanese (sp). Grilled veggie had ample toppings that were chopped small enough to get a good splattering of everything everywhere without them being too small to taste and the goat cheese wasn't so overbearing that it took over the pizza.The Milanese had a nice mix of cheeses that gave the whole thing a great flavor blend. The hummus wasn't as awesome as the pizza, but we really just came for the pizza anyway and it was just a randomly chosen prelude. I'm definitely a fan overall.

BbDLtoiZBkSXkvdtYMbGXg.text: Intermezzo has most definitely become one of my all time favorite places to eat. I eat here quite often and have never gotten a single bad thing, to eat!  The staff is always very friendly and willing to give you suggestions about different dishes!!  My favorite thing on the menu is the Wood Grilled Fungi pizza. The flavor, the crust, the EVERYTHING is just phenomenal. Appetizers, you can't go wrong with; from the bruschetta, to the garlic braided twists and the goat cheese crostini!   Intermezzo also carries one of my favorite beers, on draft: Blanche de Bruxells!!!   The atmosphere is awesome, inside and out!  All in all, there is not a single thing about Intermezzo that I dislike!!

QioE71ERUP1iaTZ3-t2qlw.text: Intermezzo is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  Their pizza is terrific, and there housemade ravioli is AMAZING.  The steak sandwich with goat cheese is also a great choice.

UWIDWj0KeiihhGUN1t9ZYw.text: No thank you. I have been here a few times, back in 2006 and again in 2015 (a few times each). Each time I am reminded why this is off the list. It is officially off the list. Went this past week and the food was blah, service was worse (one of the bartenders playfully hit my friend with a menu as if they were friends - gross and he was gross). Food was bland, beer glasses always warm. Small space and average food and warm-ish beer -- no thanks! Nothing to write home about food wise, so save the time and hit up Pint Central or Pizza Peel.

eBl5O2KUW1HO1jnMsizbrg.text: I love this place!  All of their ingredients are fresh and tasty, you'll find nothing frozen, microwaved or fried here.  I've never had a bad meal here and their specials are amazing and sell out quickly.  Worth a try!

5q95uQcEtGBB1GFTHGSkJw.text: Glad we had a gift card and didn't pay for this meal ourselves . I had a turkey burger, asked for no onions and it was covered in both purple onions and white ones were cooked in the meat, which also made it taste like meatloaf instead of a turkey burger. Not a fan of the bread it comes with personally, but if you like their pizza crust, the bread on this sandwich is the same. We also ordered fettuccini and blackened chicken, which was very bland. It just didn't have much of a taste at all. The last thing we ordered was the pepperoni sausage pizza (can't remember name). It was exactly what you ordered, so if thats the pizza you want, you'll be good to go with that one.

4Ot-LVJqfTVsx-1gj79SzA.text: Intermezzo is a lesser known gem in Plaza Midwood. It looks rather unassuming on the corner of 10th and Louise but is definitely worth the trip.   This was my third time going to Intermezzo. The first was to score some sweet happy hour deals (which are in fact, sweet including half priced appetizers) and the second was a pizza delivery when mom was in town (let's talk about how it was super quick because I'm just up the street and the pizza was piping hot and delish).   Tonight we were fortunate enough to drop in on half price martini night. I will not complain about a martini that is only $4.50. I had the peach nectar which was good, really sweet, but only had a subtle hint of booze.  For dinner, I had the Intermezzo Supreme pizza. It's a solid pizza with all kinds of toppings, a hearty crust and delicious cheese. It was so good it was hard to put down (luckily I had enough self control to bring some leftovers home). My friend had the crepe (I appreciate her dessert for dinner approach) and I stole a few bites, and that was also excellent.   Prices are definitely reasonable. 10 inch pizza and a drink for under 20 bucks. I'll definitely be going back. A lot.

QlbT0ndv6ccXmUz1Agxu-g.text: The Serbian Pizza was absolutely, astoundingly delicious. If you come here to dine, please try this dish as this is pleasing to the mouth and the palate.  The Serbian Pizza is more like an enlarged calzone, but better. I never imagined tasting sour cream, ricotta, with some tomato sauce and ham. I finished the whole thing and I'll have to come back and devour this creation again.

VBlcTwPjiySPdwDaBZA4mg.text: Excellent!   We visited early Monday evening, no wait. Service was first rate, intelligent, timely and considerate. The food: outstanding!   We had the house -made ravioli and vegetarian pizza. We'll be back.

XrOKcXWf6qjRlsf68DHYrw.text: First off - this is not the easiest place to gain access to the parking lot.  If you are coming down Central, the restaurant is on the corner of 10th & Central but you can not make a left turn - go figure!  After several u-turns, we finally made it into the parking lot and enter a whole new dining experience.  Can not say enough about the aroma when you enter.  You start salivating before you are seated.  Service was spot-on with our waiter suggesting several items and explained how they were prepared.  The three of us ordered all different dishes then played round robin.  The broyke (?) was phenominal - pastry stuffed with ground beef, onion and seasonings - how can you go wrong!  Stuffed cabbage was great especially with the recommendation from our waiter to put some hot sauce on it.  Crowning piece was the chocolate creme brulee - this was actually a vanilla creme brulee with chocolate pieces and strawberries - was so good and I do love my creme brulee.  This would stand up to any I have tasted.    Don't be put off by the appearance from the outside.  Once you enter, it is foodie heaven!

AokqfG_zu8B5AGsBQ-vQOQ.text: Super delicious!! Had the vegetarian sandwich and the goat cheese bread with a salad! Yummy!!

VF3kk2C2s6yBLAkY3xXAvQ.text: Took us, what, 2 years to finally get over here? Laaaaaame.  Comfily-dark lighting, high ceilings, back-friendly booths, and the smell of that wood-burning pizza oven = instachill. One of the best environs in the area for the full package: ze dreeenking, eating, and talking.   Food? Eh. Had the entire veg range at this point, and the peak was the Lasagna (which was awesome). Don't get me wrong, it's all better than OK - but as I'm eating my pizza funghi, I'm wishing for stronger flavor, and leaning on the salt shaker. My piroska is breadier than I imagined, and I end up sipping beer with each bite to get my kicks. What I want is to be distracted from their awesome pours (hello, Unibroue! I've missed you!!) for even just a second by something noshable. And guys, a little salt never hurt nobody.  Does it matter? Nah. Service is awesome. Space is 5stars+. So the food has some wiggle room. But what if...

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach supreme

ACc26ZVbRxXL7MwQdxlS8A.text: Great food and great atmosphere. My favorite pizza in the world is here and it's a pizza I would never even order because I hate these toppings but yet somehow at Intermezzo it works. Get the Beef Burek if you've never had it. The smoked Gouda burger. The veggie sandwich. Great owners and fantastic bar crowd.

2UAQFQ_acVM0i2NRGVIR8A.text: I'd give this a 4.5!  Yummy!!  We ordered through Foodie Call and look forward to visiting this restaurant soon!  We tried the Ground Beef Burek and the Piroska and would definitely order again.  Both were very tasty with generous serving sizes.  Familiar ingredients with great flavor combinations.

xoUNTh5VbnjOKa-lVP7MLw.text: Pizza was great! Service  was a little on the slow side. If you work, don't go for lunch. Nice crispy thin crust, quality ingredients, cool atmosphere...makes for a good meal. Pretty sure I'll be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach pizza. Comes with ricotta and mushrooms

4mp1aYX-7PV81BsNIuDM6Q.text: This place was amazing! From the food to the ambiance. There's not enough good things that I can say about our server Trey!  Overall a great experience!!

0jGdL0HX4W7d06rHprQM8w.text: Ordered lasagna.  Top portion was cold and lasagna had a cheap taste like it came from the frozen food aisle at the grocery store.  Needless to say, I won't be back

MhdRKFYvTn-w5xc8EyoG9g.text: I've never been disappointed with the food here. The dinner specials are always delicious. An entree that's always on the menu and is a definite win is the Chicken Francese. You have GOT to try it. I just tried the pizza for the first time the other night since I had heard great things and it was really good. Interesting combination of foods on the menu but it all seems to work together. The only problem I've ever had here is that the servers seem to be stretched thin sometimes so it may take an extra minute for drinks or to order your food. Not a huge issue for me. Bottom line: I love Intermezzo!

_so8eNJmup5XsUDSruB-qQ.text: Amazing!! My husband and I are HUGE pizza lovers and have found what we consider the best at Intermezzo. Plus they deliver to our home. Highly recommend a 16" with 1/2 Milanese and 1/2 Spinach Supreme. The leftovers are perfect for pizza eggs the next morning. When we dine at the restaurant, the staff is always so welcoming and nice. Can't beat delicious food and great service!

8EzvD8Xej2uyfAp9mDvU6w.text: Popped in here for a late night snack the other night.  It was a lot smaller inside was my first reaction, but not overly crowded so that's fine.  The patio however looks to be a great spot on a cool night.  The corn dip left a little to be desired and the bruschetta wasn't what I would consider typical in presentation or taste.  Left me with a big ol' plate of MEH.    The pizza (Supreme) came out and they were instantly redeemed!  Great pizza and that alone will have me coming back.

K2LtYMdS1PSNAYOemwEuVw.text: Came back here for our 2nd visit bc the food & martinis were great! Unfortunately on this visit I ordered a martini that I did not like. I tried to send it back, only to have an owner come & confront me for not liking his martini and telling me that I still had to pay for it. Needless to say, I ordered another drink, paid for the one I did not like. I will not be back because of the poor customer service.

LC8vuhVI1UoKm_ww2F-fTg.text: After having the pizza here (it was great), I came back to try the Serbian food and it was just as good or better than the pizza.  The roasted red pepper bruschetta was the best bruschetta I have ever had.  The house made mozzarella and balsamic vinegar are incredible.  For dinner, I tried the beef burek.  It looks like a honey bun and tastes amazing (also very filling).  As good as the beef burek was, the Karadjordjeva was even better.  It is extremely tender and the Kajmak cheese and dill tartar sauce make it amazing.  If you want takeout and/or pizza, I highly recommend ordering your pizza from here.  It is the best I have had so far in Charlotte.  If you would rather eat at the restaurant, the food (aside from the pizza) is incredible as well.  Service is good and prices are fair, so the value is strong as well.

oM4Tzom75a59D4oSkjD2NQ.text: Food was fresh and tasty but service was very slow...and served with an attitude. It was a Sunday afternoon lunch. We sat outside and it wasn't busy...which made the poor service all the more confounding.

lwK-OM2iAMuIzz6Mmxi_1g.text: We have been here several times and it is worth mentioning this gem of food and drink.  Every visit has been with great service, amazing drink specials and never failing delicious apps and mains.   We've had every app, all worth it.  Last time we had martinis and they were mixed like the best we've had and with a cool atmosphere.  We take family here from out of town when we need a slam dunk of a meal.

6hVJv0XsszD-vQEZLx4mQg.text: Awesome food, amazing service and a solid place for anytime of the week. It has become a regular Friday night visit for the family.

wFChQiyIGyOPmhYZnZ3Aeg.text: You can find mind blowing food, in Charlotte, NC at Intermezzo a Serbian restaurant. Not only are the servers out going and friendly, it is a yuppy dive fun look. The food was impressive, they have an amazing piroska in which holds ham, mushrooms, mozzarella, and ricotta cheese, and sour cream with tomato sauce. It was delicious, along with the chicken florentin pizza, my personal favorite and its the best one I have ever had. I also had to get the tiramisu, for I have a terrible sweet tooth, and it was made to perfection. I found this restaurant because it was shown on Diners Drive Ins and Dives. Hope you go and enjoy the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

aYospxnrRnkI2Bk58JRrOg.text: It's rare that I do this, but even though our food was pretty uneventful, I loved the atmosphere and service at Intermezzo so much that I have to give them 4 stars! The fella and I had Groupon, and we ventured in on a Wednesday night. Although outdoor seating is a possibility, it was too cold the night we went.   I don't know what I expected it to look like on the inside, but it sooo surpassed that - exposed brick walls, nooks and crannies with quaint tables, knick knacks lining a high railing around the bar, cozy, red, hanging lights illuminating the bar... love! We were greeted by the nicest, friendliest man when we walked in, and our waitress (Kate?) was so helpful and fun. I loved everything about it. Seating is fairly limited inside - there were maybe 6 or 7 booths, a few tables, and then 6-8 chairs at the bar.  I decided to get the Becka Snicla (which is pretty much like wienerschnitzel) for $13.25, and the fella settled on the Karadjordjeva for $13.95. He definitely won. Mine wasn't bad; it was just a little bland and dry. He gave me a few bites of his - I had been a little worried about the tartar sauce before we ordered, but it was just drizzled on top, which made there enough for a kick, but not enough to gross me out like tartar sauce usually does. Overall, it was better than mine, but still a little underwhelming.  Maybe we just got the wrong thing and should've stuck to the pizza or the burek? Either way, I'd go back just for the atmosphere and service and chalk up this trip to ordering the wrong things.

2zDJpMAOV2ORe0pBtpVS3Q.text: I love when a groupon find correlates with a pleasant dinning experience. On a late night friday we decided to put my Groupon addiction to good use. I have passed this place a million times and finally decided to check it out.  We sat outside, a personal favorite of mine. Perfect late summer evening idea. I've  never eaten Serbian food, so I'm glad our waiter was knowledgeable and helpful with suggestions.   Based on the recommendations, Colin got the Karadjordjeva Pan Seared Schnitzel rolled with Ham, Kajmak, Skillet Potatoes, and Tartar Sauce. it was great. I ordered on the side of caution with the Chicken Francese. It was heavenly. Walking out to our car, after enjoying our dinner, we made a last minute move to get some Tiramisu to go. Oh Man, I'm so glad we did, a little bit on the Pricey side, but it was AmaZing.  A good tip to keep in mind, this place is open Late, until 2am!

NmHv4Gd6JYNT2YoCJwPUpQ.text: This place is amazing. CONSISTENT! Always consistently delicious food. Service is fantastic. Prices are really fair. By far the best restaurant in CLT. Been here a dozen + times and always leave full and happy!!

j84bpvmV30wtkxq_0nfTzQ.text: The service was awesome as was the pizza but the crepe was EVERYTHING. The best I've ever had. I've passed this place a million times but never stopped. I'm glad we decided to pop in tonight. The owner was friendly and Trey was knowledgeable and offered tips on the menu and took his time explaining the items to us as first timers. Everything is fresh and made in house daily.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. The crepe!

myZxMnXl67dndIau18OWxA.text: The entrance is a little confusing. Yes, you have to walk through or around the patio to the get to the front door. The service is good but the hostess can stand to learn some customer service skills. But all that aside, we really enjoy Intermezzo. They have pizza and Serbian food. Yup. That's right... One strange combination but it works!  We've tried the pizza (excellent!) and the Serbian dishes (BEEF BUREK FTW!). I also love places that bring you freshly grated parm. It's entered the rotation as a usual spot!

0n8EHc2ROM55dB9MIp0mvw.text: Don't be fooled by the sign reading "Pizzeria and Cafe" on the outside of Intermezzo's flavor-filled walls. There's gold in them there walls. Lovely, Serbian and Italian culinary gold. That's right. I said Serbian. You're in for a roller coaster ride of freshness and delight.   The location rests off of 10th street and accessed from Central. Pull into the gravel parking lot and sit in the small dining area or on their glorious patio. Stays cool even in the summertime!   Intermezzo is a small staffed joint that makes everything in house. They don't even have a freezer! They make their own phyllo, mozzarella and salad dressings. It doesn't stop there. Ask your server and they'll be able to tell you ad nauseum on how many fresh items are being churned out of that tiny kitchen. It's ridiculous.   So, feeling a bit nervous about trying Serbian cuisine? Never fear! Order the Burek and thank me later. Phyllo filled with cheese and spinach or ground beef. It comes with a house salad, the balsamic reduction and small side of tzatziki-ish cucumber salad. Each bite of the Burek is tender and savory. Mix up the flavors! I take each bite with a bit of salad and the cucumber mixture. Everything swirls with happiness.   Best vegetarian lasagna I've ever had. The marinara and ricotta work together like old pals. My goodness these guys make lasagna like I've never had. Out of this world fresh flavors and packed full of zucchini, squash, onions, tomatoes and other veg.   Bruschetta. All I can say is GET IT. House made mozzarella and fresh bread, tomatoes, basil. Need I say more?   This place packs a punch with their small bar, too. Tons of local beers and plenty of mixed drinks for you to pair with your meal. Great wine list as well. What Italian joint comes sans wine? Not this place.   If you haven't made it into Intermezzo yet, you're in for a treat. One of the Charlotte gems that you'll frequent on the regular. Cheers!

Gn1PiTdaMYKJ5HtZHqe-iQ.text: This is my homage to my new favorite pizza place in Charlotte.  My husband and I found a Groupon for Intermezzo ($16 for $30 worth of food). We ordered the house Sauvignon blanc while pondering the simple but diverse menu) appetizers, pizza, sandwiches and salads, and Serbian dishes). We settled on garlic knots, the quatro formaggio pizza and the beef burek (one of the Serbian dishes - filo dough, beef, and cheese).   Everything was incredibly delicious - even though they were some of the more generic/plain dishes.  The house wine was semi-sweet and subtle. The garlic knots had fresh garlic and butter on top and came with the best marinara I've ever had while dining out. The pizza was perfectly salty and cheesy, and the Serbian dish came with the best green salad with balsamic dressing and a cucumber & sour cream salad. Normally, I don't over eat, but everything tasted so good that I was quite full when I made myself stop. Portions were quite large, so half the pizza and about half of the burek were brought home.   Ambiance: The building is old and unique with a kind of New England style (brick with wooden rafters and shuttered windows). It was a great setting for a quiet romantic date night - the music selection was pretty awesome as well.   The only complaint I have is that there are televisions at all (but whatever, some people like that kind of thing).   Overall: I was really impressed with the service and quality of food. My husband and I are excited to try other pizzas and Serbian dishes here.

MBGx9K4pAdsnGE5yf0qnDQ.text: Brought a date here, neither one of us had ever been. The atmosphere was nice, the service was great and the food was excellent! She had the sarma and it was amazing! We will definitely be back for more!

jMkyxL-oDRjmGwSBJVmELg.text: Really wish we'd had read the recent reviews before ordering tonight  Daaaaaaamn.....this place blows now! Over an hour delivery time for a place that's right down the street. When the lady got here she sat in her car for like 3 minutes so i went out & she continued to rustle around her car for another couple of minutes. When she finally came out she said, "Oh, you must be hungry!".....weird. Girlfriend got Cajun chicken pasta with extra broccoli & they gave 2 very small pieces & 1 medium piece & half the pasta portion they used to give. My fungi pizza needed salt & was cold & to top it all off, the desert crepes were burnt. Ha. I called them to try & talk to someone in charge but all I could get was the bartender, who kept oddly calling me buddy lol. He told me that the owner had just delivered my food & she would be back shortly. Wtf? Why was the owner delivering food? Anyway, 30 minutes later I actually get a call back & it's some guy. I start to tell him what happened & he starts immediately getting defensive & arguing with everything I say. Then he tells me I don't seem to be happy with anything. Insinuating that I just like to complain. I tell him about the broccoli & he tells me I'm lying & that i never ordered it online....wow. Not to mention, it seemed like around $15 worth of food for $47!!! Bad food at that. Never going back, sorry guys. Maybe you should read these & learn something.

gyn76piu1F5On9518UtAIw.text: My boyfriend and I randomly decided to go here since I used to live right down the street.  The inside was a bit small and cramped but the more I hung out there, the more I found it to be cozy instead.  We sat at the bar since the place was busy and we wanted a good beer.  I ordered the Eggplant Mousaka and the bf ordered Sarma (cabbage rolls).  I never finish my meal before my bf but I inhaled every bite of my mousaka!  Not only was the food absolutely amazing and as authentic as it gets, the owner (I assume) was behind the bar and we talked for a good 20 minutes about authentic Serbian cuisine and how all the dishes were made.  He was so enthusiastic and excited to talk about his food and share it with us!  We learned so much!  To top it off, some of the beers on tap were local.  Enough said.  I will definitely be going back!

HbD2m7wN5yLBL9U72EFItA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Cool aesthetic inside. The roasted red pepper hummus is a great starter. All of the several pizzas and Serbian dishes I've had were excellent. I'm looking forward to trying the pastas next. It's also IMO the best pizza delivery available in the surrounding area (P-M, Elizabeth, etc.)

A-T1v5K_Un8BYBQIFWBTMg.text: Best pizza, in Charlotte! Hands down Intermezzo, whips the competition. I live in SC, But I frequently attend concerts in Charlotte and a stop at Intermezzo, is always a must!

yP-z5f8VNPZbIk4iqEnFkg.text: Was a fan of Intermezzo, then last night realized that face was more than a passing familiarity, but my beloved bartender from years ago at Cosmos. Georgio and his brother, wife and family, and a few more friends pour their passion into this groovy grotto. Amazing food, and great wine, for unbeatable prices!  5 stars, because Georgio delivers--yes, to NoDa!   Best small bar with nightly specials to intrigue each night of the week.  xoxo, lemon drop

G3HWQn3Z58_Kh55WlEsjkg.text: Never been here before so I tried it with a groupon.  Whole experience was excellent!  The food the service both were outstanding!  Our waiter Georgie (sp) one of the owners was extremely nice and full of personality and very helpful throughout.    We started with the corn dip, it's was sweet and flavorful with a hint of spice, the tortilla chips were average and a little too salty but overall still a great appetizer.   My girlfriend and I shared a 10" pizza and the beef burek and they were both great.  The pizza was a Capriccioso which is basically meat lovers and was excellent, could stand alone as just a pizza place for me.  The beef burek was also very good.  I didn't know what to expect it was my first experience with Serbian food but it was a nice surprise.  It was meticulously stuffed fillo dough made from scratch and had good flavor, we were encouraged to try a bite of it with the cucumber mixture and the salad and it was quite good but I enjoyed it by itself also.  Finished with crepes for dessert and again owner went out of his way I have a hazel nut allergy so he made one regular crepe for my girlfriend and one crepe for me using a different chocolate sauce.   We will surely be back and happy to pay regular price but will also be on the lookout for future groupons as this place was a hit!  Speaking of groupon they made it super easy to redeem and did so with a smile on their face!

Mbvu5M6NzPoS-qGBkCeC3A.text: The food was way over priced, the portion size was way to small, the bartender was a dick as he just threw my change at me, I guess at least the food was half decent? Won't see me there again

foIZSBu9wgNMghRrviJKXg.text: Placed order online, never received confirmation. Called, and they couldn't find my order, still have login to their correct url. They put me on hold, put the phone down on desk, after 10 min I gave up.

3RwcVfSLBpDXyAvC8oqu4g.text: The food here is pretty good but our service in the bar was kind of unfriendly. Followed next was slow and irritated service on the patio. It took 10 minutes to receive our menus, from a server who seemed frazzled and upset.  However, the whole experience was wonderful because I had lovely company. Had I just been here to experience the restaurant and not my guests I would have been extremely disappointed and dissatisfied by the service. However, it's cute and delish so I still would recommend it.

aJL3MUzqntbTESJrvlgfrg.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants spots in Charlotte. Warm and cozy ambiance, excellent service, and amazing food! We love the pizza, pasta, and Serbian dishes. Who knew Serbian food was so delicious?! The server, Trey, is probably the friendliest server I've ever had and we eat out about 2-3 times per week. We just can't get enough of this place! I wish I would have discovered it sooner .

199nZ6D5EDF0y1tc84zpjg.text: I WANT to rate this place a 5.  We love the food and atmosphere.  But the bar staff is SO surly and inattentive that I really only come here rarely anymore.  And it hasn't changed.  If the owner reads this: get new bartenders.  They are seriously holding back a first class restaurant.

exjdXV1qozAp6rXEWrLkUg.text: Yummy with healthy Italian/Mediterranean type food. Every time I come here I get something different and I am never disappointed. I met two friends here, a couple, and I was first to arrive. Ha this time the hostess almost sat me with someone I didn't know, and newly single I told her she was trying to be a match maker.   We ordered the corn dip as an appetizer and pretty darn good. They also have hummus and many others, but I wanted to save room for pizza! I had not tried it yet. Oh and it was delicious! We got the Spinach pizza and talk about heaven. Oh and you  can get a ready cook pizza of your choice to take home and bake if you like.  I've never had a bad experience here, lasagna, did I just say that? Yeah that's my other fav here. Service is awesome and I will be back here again soon. As with all Plasma Wig wood places parking is slim, especially in weekend nights.   I hope everyone enjoys this place as much as I have. Happy eating!

msYLBOutoU94eXRr-ZqGyA.text: My wife and I love this place. It's never been too busy and we love there food. We ordered the corn dip as an app and it is amazing!! I had a pizza which was delicious. My wife always get the vegetarian lasagna which she orders EVERYTIME  She tells me it is the best she has ever had. We will continue to come here when in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Intermezzo Pizzeria and Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn dip is amazing!!

FjnYXq0JpKQIEh5Uvpwvgw.text: I'm going to keep this simple.  We were here for pizza and really that is all.  The place has a nice vibe...active, bustling, energizing.  We had to wait about 15 minutes on a Friday night which isn't too bad.  We sat down, received pretty good service and ordered a couple 10 inch pizzas.    They were good!  I don't remember the names but one had bacon on it and mine had chicken, tomatoes and goat cheese I think.  The toppings were minimal therefore unmemorable.  The crust was good but the pizza slices were a little greasy and so the tip of the pizza was flapped over...just a personal pet peeve.    The prices were a little high for what you get but probably market.  I don't know..everything was just OK.  I could easily go to Harris Teeter and pick up Amy's margarita pizza in the frozen section and be just as satisfied.  There were other things on the menu that looked decent but I just wasn't overly impressed.  It gets a solid 3 stars for my whole experience.

Cjp8TtgBjWpFeL0OFkIukg.text: Casual dining, but everything is just so yummy! I was looking for something outside the usual to show my mom the range of eateries in Charlotte and Intermezzo hit the buttons for different. Serbian. And close to uptown for a look at the lights.  Greeted warmly, we took a table inside. Not the widest menu, but the choices were excellent.  We started with the garlic twists. Excellent choice - light and fluffy with a marinara sauce to dip in. All gone! For the mains, since my mom is a veggie, she had the vegetarian lasagna and really enjoyed it. I went with the stuffed cabbage and wow, it was excellent. Thick cabbage leaves with a spicy (not hot spicy, this is tasty spicy) ground beef and rice mix in a broth that was served with a loaf of homemade bread. I used up all the bread to soak up the fab broth.  For dessert, we went with the fruit stuffed crepes. Fresh (not frozen) strawberries and banana slices with a hazlenut chocolate drizzle.  There was some fighting involved for the last bit.  Interesting beer choices, I had a Belgian wheat beer that was excellent.  Strong recommendation! Great food, nice ambiance!

-nRPi4PzQoCoe9J9DQfBXA.text: We (four of us -- two adults, two teens) visited Intermezzo this past Monday night.  We had been there once before for dinner and found it just ok.  We hadn't tried the pizza, though, so we decided to give it another try.    Upon entering, we could see that there was no one manning the host desk and little to no "waiting room" inside the door.  We could also see that all of the tables were already occupied.  We were greeted by someone who basically informed us that they were "all full," as if to rudely imply that they didn't need any more customers.  "Unless you want to sit outside" (it was 40 degrees out) or "eat at the bar," we were then told, spotting four available seats together.  We agreed to eat at the bar and began taking our seats.  We were then asked by the bartender if the teens were underage.  Yes.  Duh.  He then informed us that they couldn't sit at the bar because they were underage.  We then tried to explain that we were just there for dinner and weren't going to drink.  We further explained that we only came to the bar because we were TOLD and OFFERED to sit at the bar by the person by the door.  The bartender just kept insisting that we couldn't sit at the bar.  No one -- bartender, manager on duty, etc. -- offered an apology for the error and miscommunication or even gave us alternatives!  Instead, they all just made us feel unwelcome.  How crazy is that?    So, instead we just left all furious and went to enjoy a fantastic meal and service at Midwood Smokehouse just up the street.  We'll never even attempt to return to Intermezzo with its crazy rude service and inability to function as a welcoming establishment.

GeiUuvbzM4pTVwxwG9Pmrg.text: Couldn't wait to try this place while in town, after seeing the DDD episode with that Piroska.  I wasn't sure about the sour cream part of it, but it works so well.  I went here three times in one week.  I got the sauteed veggies pasta, stuffed cabbage, and Piroska.  The stuffed cabbage and that bread were so good, and hit the spot with the juicy meat stuffed inside that crisp cabbage.  The tomato sauce juice in the bowl you can just drink, it was that good.  But dip the bread in there, that bread is amazing!  The Piroska everyone was getting, and when I got mine I must have eaten it within five minutes.  It was awesome!  Go here and order anything off the menu, even the pizza looked great!

rhQca-ZPOtSkdhsQmeGhKA.text: I was really excited to try this place, however, was worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant. I would rate it zero stars if I could. The waitress was so awful I was afraid to ask for a water refill and when I did she gave us warm water with no ice. Half the time you were mid sentence and she would walk away. Also, we waited over 2.5 hours for food that was either under cooked or over cooked. Will never go here again.

S20MoRQxulFto5ux5mfz_w.text: From the servers to the music to the fun decor to the food and drink, this place is consistently one of our favorites!

OJVisgxOnkio-J4ubOYmXw.text: This place always has great service!  Specializing in Serbian food, Intermezzo is different and delicious. I suggest starting with the hummus, getting a pizza for your main course and drinking a LOT of their yummy tap beers.

QAoip1sgRec1oDZkC-qFBg.text: I can't believe it's taken me so long to review this place. I've been eating here for a year or so and I used to love them. Used to.   The food was really phenomenal. Everything I ordered was delicious, from the appetizers to the burgers to the traditional Serbian dishes. I'd get a hankering and try something new every so often and it never disappointed.... until recently.  Several months ago, the incorrect dish was delivered to me, and I'd barely even opened the food before the guy showed up again with the correct dish and apologized. Wow. I told him it wasn't necessary in this case, or I would have called, but he insisted that they had to get me the right order because of who I was (loyal customer). I was really touched by how concerned they were with getting the exact order right. Great food, great customer service - what more could you ask for?   A few months after that, things just tanked. Things were left out of our order - I called to let them know and said it wasn't a big deal, but FYI. The second time, I asked for their tomato sauce. That stuff was seriously delicious the first time I had it - so I wanted some more without having to order an entire dish of it. I called and totally offered to pay extra. They charged me $3.50 and I got the equivalent of, like, 2 ketchup packets of sauce. Really? That is super chintzy. This last order (offense number three), we got the stuffed peppers and the weinerschnitzel. It was the smallest piece of meat they'd ever made for us in over a year. On top of that, we were given one small pepper, instead of the two that normally come in an order. We paid $15 for one single medium-sized stuffed pepper? To make matters worse, the taste of this insanely expensive tomato sauce was just not the same. Did they change chefs?   I called and was nice about it, but just was wondering what the heck was going on. I was told I'd get a call back and I never did. I don't know what's happening with Intermezzo, but they've gone from possibly my favorite place to eat in Charlotte to one of the worst amount-of-food-for-your-money ratio and with zero customer service.

vdasbujdn6gRm37blHRBZw.text: I've been here often but things have slipped, foodwise. Our four mushroom pizza had only a handful of limp slivers -- not the juicy assortment we'd had before. And the roasted veggie pizza offered only a handful of chopped onions and other diced greens rather than the smokey slices we'd enjoyed previously. Anyone can have an off night so we'll try again.
